title: Marine Technical Specialist
description:
A Place Where People Matter.

Want to work for a company that is reimaging distribution? Join Univar Solutions, the premier global distributor of chemicals and ingredients working to fulfill our purpose to help keep communities healthy, fed, clean and safe. Our goal is to function as a direct extension of our customers’ teams; to serve as an ally in their quest of business success.

When you work for Univar Solutions, you’ll play an important role, in shaping how we deliver more than chemicals and ingredients. To read more about our successes and what we do, please visit: www.univarsolutions.com

What we offer:
  • Flexible work program
  • Paid training and development programs at every level
  • Global career advancement and mentoring opportunities
  • Education allowance
  • Competitive salary, benefits to include; employer paid medical & dental, short term and long term disability coverage, pension with employer matched contributions
  • Employee Resource Networks that are advocating for advancing diversity, equity and inclusion within the company.

What you’ll do:

Reporting to the Terminal Manager, this position will support the site to implement Univar Safety Management Systems and Security Requirements appropriately and effectively.

  • You will be the Training Coordinator for all site personnel, longshore operators and foremen, marine surveyors, truck drivers, and a variety of other roles that support the site
  • You will hold the Marine Facility Security Officer (MFSO) role and be responsible for tasks such as updating the Transport Canada Marine Security Plan along with managing all efforts re: site CTPAT certification
  • You will provide Responsible Distribution (RD) Support which includes attending Community Advisory Panel meetings, Port of Vancouver Environmental meetings, as well as supporting the North Shore Waterfront Industrial Association school program with classroom visits, and supporting North Shore Emergency Management efforts
  • You will be the coordinator for a variety of audits such as TDG, Environment Canada, Transport Canada Marine Security, Kosher, Responsible Distribution, and customer quality audits
  • You will be the coordinator for a variety of reporting requirements, such as site KPIs, internal water reporting and air emissions, site incident reporting and participation in, and documentation of, Root Cause Investigations, and tracking action items
  • You will be the site compliance coordinator for WorkSafe, federal requirements, and site systems including groundwater surveys, IH monitoring, annual foam testing, and site waste management
  • You will coordinate safety meetings and perform housekeeping walkabouts and work with Univar EHS to ensure good communication of initiatives and best practices
  • You will be part of the NVDC site on call operations team and have on call responsibilities 1/3 of the time. This will involve attending vessels and coordinating labour on some frequency
  • Additional tasks that arise at manager’s discretion

What you’ll need:

  • Commitment to doing the right thing, and always working in an ethical manner
  • Ability to build and maintain positive working relationships with a diverse group of stakeholders, implement initiatives and leverage knowledge from internal Univar subject matter experts
  • Ideally, a post-secondary degree/diploma in related field to Occupational Health and Safety; Safety Management, Quality Systems or Regulatory
  • Five (5) years direct experience in EHS required
  • Knowledge of regulations such as Transportation of Dangerous Goods, Environmental Emergency Regulations, Workplace Hazardous Information Systems, and Occupational Health and Safety
  • Available for on-call work

Sounds awesome? Apply today!

All qualified applicants will receive consideration and will not be discriminated against based on their race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected classification. If you are an applicant that requires a specific accommodation due to a disability or medical need during the recruitment process, please email us at careers@univarsolutions.com.

Join our team today – challenge your limits!
Growing Together
Show more

title: Survey Manager
description:
EXPRESSION OF INTEREST

Pennecon is a leading provider of integrated solutions throughout the heavy civil, industrial, services & maintenance, and marine industries. Powered by an energetic team all across Canada, we are united by our passion and determination to deliver results on the most complex jobs and challenging environments.

Pennecon Heavy Civil is currently bidding on major project work within the Western Canadian region and are seeking individuals who are qualified and interested in joining our team in the role of:

Role: Survey Manager

Location: Western Canada

The primary duties to this position will be the following:

  • Work with and can operate GPS survey equipment, total stations, and other survey equipment for construction layout and record of measurement;
  • Carry out a variety of project CAD design and field survey activities including topographic surveys, field layout;
  • Generate 3D models for construction;
  • Compare as-built data vs design data to identify quantity, grade, or location discrepancies;
  • Interpret and reconcile as-built quantities for monthly progress reports/ payments;
  • Manage survey equipment within the western region including procurement, tracking, equipment calibration, repairs, etc;
  • Basic maintenance, review, and repair of systems in the field;
  • Quality control documentation;
  • Manage and perform field surveys from sites all across Western Canada;
  • Coach surveyors in the field ensuring they have necessary resources to be successful on their project scopes;
  • Ability to manage a high volume work load in a fast paced work environment;
  • Consistently ensure that safety, quality, and environmental standards are being followed and maintained through each phase of construction

The successful candidate for the role will bring:

  • Possess a Diploma in Survey or Engineering Technology from an accredited institution;
  • Minimum of eight (8) years’ surveyor experience;
  • Knowledge and experience with AutoCad and other related 3D software programs;
  • A good understanding of civil construction – concrete, pipe, drainage, earthworks etc;
  • Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, high volume, deadline-driven environment;
  • Strong communication skills

The successful candidate is passionate about the work they do and has excellent interpersonal, communication, organizational and computer skills; with a commitment to safe work practices and are an effective team player with a positive attitude. Experience working in a Construction environment where responsiveness and ability to work and adapt to varying environments will be critical in this role. There is an expectation to work extended work schedules, which includes holidays and weekends.

Travel away from home will be required. Preferred candidates will be open to travel and construction project work, and be on a defined rotation work schedule. Competitive living out allowance will be provided.

Pennecon is committed to equity in employment and encourages all qualified individuals to apply. We thank all candidates for their interest, but wish to advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Find out more about Pennecon by visiting our website at www.pennecon.com

title: Material Testing Technician
description:
The Opportunity:
What’s better than living in a city that offers great recreation, amenities, and affordable housing? What about the ability to grow your career in a community that is the right fit for you? McElhanney has a new opportunity for a Materials Testing Technician to join our growing team in Courtenay, BC.

The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work on both field and laboratory testing projects, and potentially assist other divisions, Survey, Civil, Structural and Marine Structural. This position will work closely with our Geotechnical and Civil Engineering teams to deliver construction quality control and quality assurance services.

McElhanney’s in-house materials testing laboratories deliver prompt, locally focused materials testing services throughout BC. Complementing our local laboratories, our fleet of mobile laboratories enables our qualified technicians to provide responsive on-site services, even in remote areas. We offer our services for the following project needs: construction aggregate testing, soil and concrete testing, and asphalt testing.

What You’ll Be Doing: :
    • Working as part of a multi-discipline team of highly skilled engineers, technicians, surveyors, and drafters to provide excellent service to our clients
    • Conducting laboratory soil testing including wash sieve analysis, modified and standard proctors
    • Conducting laboratory concrete testing including compressive strength of concrete cylinders
    • Conducting laboratory asphalt testing, marshall properties
    • Conducting field testing of concrete (slump, air content, cast cylinders).
    • Conducting field compaction testing using a nuclear densometer
    • Timely preparation of reports
    • Other duties as required

What You’ll Bring:
    • Prior experience with earthworks/concrete construction and an interest in construction technology
    • A diploma in Civil Engineering Technology is an asset, but not required
    • Canadian Council of Independent Laboratories (CCIL)/American Concrete Institution (ACI) certification or the ability to obtain certification
    • Knowledge of Canadian Standards Association (CSA) and American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM) testing methods would be considered an asset
    • Physical ability to lift heavy equipment, willing to work in various environmental conditions with varied terrain, able to work in wildlife populated areas and willing to work in remote areas when needed
    • Good attitude and willingness to work cooperatively as a team player
    • Strong communication skills and leadership capabilities.

What Can We Offer You?:
    • Flexible work hours to accommodate your lifestyle
    • Great benefits, including extended health & dental coverage, healthcare spending account, & RRSP matching
    • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
    • Competitive salary and participation in our generous Performance Bonus Plan
    • Financial assistance with relocation if applicable
    • Opportunity to become a shareholder in an employee-owned firm
    • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
    • Continuous support for your professional development and growth
    • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone
    • Participation in our numerous programs that support our Four Cornerstones: people & communities, clients & partners, processes & technology, and financial.
About McElhanney:
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.
Our Purpose: Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.:
#LI-AM3 #Junior #Hybrid
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers: to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor

A beautiful and vibrant city on the east coast of Vancouver Island, Courtenay’s residents love its stunning scenery and recreational opportunities, as well as its affordability. World-class beaches are only a short drive away!

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.

McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Surveyor
description:
DOF Subsea is a leading provider of subsea services offering the world’s offshore energy producers integrated offshore services from a single company around the world. With world class Subsea services (Remote Operated Vehicles and Survey), Marine services with a fleet of offshore construction vessels, and renewable services including floating offshore wind, the group combines expertise and technology to deliver integrated solutions.

DOF Subsea Canada is currently seeking a detailed oriented and client focused individual for the position of Surveyor. A key to success for this position is the ability to collaborate with offshore and onshore personnel. The Surveyor will report to the Project Manager. If you are looking for a dynamic environment to learn and grow your career, DOF Subsea Canada is a great opportunity!

Requirements

Key Responsibilities

  • Operate all survey-related equipment on the vessel including the collection and recording of survey data of the required quality
  • Support the coordination of activities with the vessel and/or ROV crew.
  • Prepare, use, and maintain all relevant survey logs and documentation.
  • Maintain order and tidiness in the survey area and any other survey-related compartment on the vessel.
  • Ensure that all equipment and instruments are adequately secured and sea-fastened.
  • Monitor real-time displays; examine calibration, data plots and charts/maps. Maintain continual communication with other survey personnel.
  • Support the mobilisation/demobilisation of the survey vessel.
  • Ensure that all survey-related equipment is in excellent working condition. Be familiar with equipment lists, checklists, service reports, and to confirm that there is no shortage of equipment and parts.
  • Report and follow up deficiencies, damaged equipment, safety hazards, or incidents; by using the appropriate reporting system (e.g., failure/breakdown, SJA, non-conformity).
  • Provide key data and information to the Senior Surveyor/Party Chief, for the preparation of survey reports.
  • Be aware of those critical activities being performed on board that consume vessel time. This is to ensure that work is performed as efficient as possible without any unnecessary delay. Whenever possible, provide suggestions for improvements to teamwork and operational techniques.


Key Qualifications and Experience:

  • Post Secondary Education in Subsea studies with a concentration in Oil & Gas, Renewables
  • Hydrographic Survey or Geomatics degree or similar education
  • At least 2– 5 years experience as Surveyor within Oil & Gas Industry.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Suite - Word/Excel/PowerPoint and Document Control Systems.
  • Excellent interpersonal, organizational and communication skills

*DOF Subsea Canada is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and equitable workplace. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply*

title: Class Society Coordinator
description:
Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

The Class Society Coordinator (CSC) is responsible to ensure efficient communications between the RCN, SNC-Lavalin ship maintenance coordinators, SNC-Lavalin surveyors, and the DND Classification Society Surveyors, and for coordinating support services for all classification society activities associated with SNC-Lavalin’s Minor Warships and Auxiliary Vessel (MWAV) contract. The CSC is SNC-Lavalin’s point of contact for classification society related inquiries associated with the MWAV project and is required to be well-versed in classification society standards and requirements. The CSC coordinates activities associated with the surveys and inspections on a variety of different vessels. The CSC must be physically capable of working on ships and have no restrictions related to use of any personnel protection equipment or ability to access any space, including confined spaces, in support of the surveys.

How will you contribute to the team?

The CSC is responsible for ensuring efficient communication between the Department of National Defence (DND), DND’s Approved Classification Society, and SNC-Lavalin. The CSC:

  • Maintains professional records of all activities and provides reports as required.
  • Maintains accurate and up-to-date work schedules of surveys and associated support activities.
  • Coordinates sub-contractor support to DND’s Approved Classification Society at various locations ensuring communication is open and requirements are understood.
  • Initiates and facilitates required service provider support for surveys and inspections.
  • Supports SNC-Lavalin’s quality, environmental, health, and safety specialists and SMCs to oversee classification society surveys and support activities.
  • Maintains communication and coordinates with Ship Maintenance Coordinators, SNC-Lavalin Surveyors, and other SNC-Lavalin organizations.
  • Maintains communications and coordinates with Fleet Maintenance Facilities to support Classification Society activities.
  • Maintains communication and coordinates with ship’s staff to facilitate required support activities.
  • Maintains accurate and up-to-date data to support KPIs and OFIs.
  • Monitors applicable work in the Management Information System (MIS) to ensure coordination of classification society activities. NOTE – the CSC does not enter WEAFs for SMC or other parties but monitors MIS to ensure these are entered correctly in order to complete the necessary support to the classification society.

Supervisory and leadership role -

This position does not have supervisory responsibilities. However, the incumbent may occasionally provide guidance/training to others and/or informing project personnel of the status of assigned responsibilities.

What will you contribute?

Education and knowledge –

  • 3-year technical program diploma offered by a recognized technical institute or certified as a technologist by a recognized provincial, state or federal (national) licensing body or certified to the QL-6B level of military technical training.
  • Possess a minimum of three (3) years of demonstrated marine experience within the last 10 years.
  • Fluent in English and able to communicate verbally and in writing.

Training and relative work experience –

  • Good understanding of Health and Safety programs.
  • Ability to obtain a security clearance of Enhanced Reliability.
  • Must be familiar with ISSC waterfront activities.
  • Experience in the use of MIS is an asset.
  • Project management experience is considered an asset.
  • Sound understanding of DND internal workings.
  • Strong understanding of planning and scheduling of maintenance activities.
  • Familiarization with ISO 9001, 14001, and 18001.
  • Working knowledge of RCN MBS systems, systems requiring certification, Classification society rules, SOLAS, and Transport Canada is considered an asset.
  • Be conversant with MS Office software (Outlook, Word, Excel, Project).
  • Strong time management skills, with initiative and follow-up capabilities.

Personal attributes for position –

  • Team Player
  • Flexible to change
  • Enthusiastic and dedicated
  • Approachable
  • Solutions driven
  • Attention to detail
  • Methodical
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Superior planning and organizing abilities
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Coordinate and control multiple tasks at the same time.
  • Write Technical Reports.

Physical requirements –

  • Good Health
  • Able to climb tanks steps, ladders, and vertical shipboard ladders.
  • Able to climb from dry dock deck level to the inside of the ship bilges a number of times.
  • Able to remain on your feet for extended periods (five hours or longer).
  • Able to work in various weather conditions.
  • Able to carry / lift loads of up to 15 kg.

What do we offer at SNC-Lavalin?

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy good compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (i.e., group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

  • Opportunity to work on various projects of various sizes.
  • Competitive salary.
  • Motivational financial package & flexible benefits.
  • Defined contribution pension plan in which SNC-Lavalin contributes.
  • Work equipment provided according to the season (boot, bib, helmet, gloves, etc.).
  • Employee Share Ownership Plan (ESOP).
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
  • Learning and Development programs, training, career opportunities.

Additional Information:

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire candidates with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world. SNC-Lavalin connects people, technology and data to help shape and deliver world-leading concepts and projects, while offering comprehensive innovative solutions across the asset lifecycle. Our expertise is wide-ranging — consulting & advisory, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and sustaining capital – and delivered to clients in four strategic sectors: EDPM (engineering, design and project management), Infrastructure, Nuclear and Resources, supported by Capital. People. Drive. Results. www.snclavalin.com

title: Laboratory Technician
description:
The Opportunity:
What’s better than living in a city that offers great recreation, amenities, and affordable housing? What about the ability to grow your career in a community that is the right fit for you? McElhanney has a new opportunity for a Laboratory Technician to join our growing team in Fort St. John, BC.

The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work on both field and laboratory testing projects, and potentially assist other divisions, Survey, Civil, Structural and Marine Structural. This position will work closely with our Geotechnical and Civil Engineering teams to deliver construction quality control and quality assurance services.

McElhanney’s in-house materials testing laboratories deliver prompt, locally focused materials testing services throughout BC. Complementing our local laboratories, our fleet of mobile laboratories enables our qualified technicians to provide responsive on-site services, even in remote areas. We offer our services for the following project needs: construction aggregate testing, soil and concrete testing, and asphalt testing.

Live in Fort St. John: :
Located in the heart of the majestic Peace River country, Fort St. John is the largest city in Northeastern BC and supports a trading area of more than 70,000 people in the city and outlying service region. The population is dynamic, young, and energetic and, as the population continues to grow, so does the supply of retail shopping and other amenities. The friendly, small-town feel is matched with big city amenities, creating a fantastic combination for many to call home. Fort St. John offers top-notch indoor recreation facilities and endless opportunities for outdoor adventures, and being “The Energetic City”, has hundreds of events taking place every year that entertain people of all ages and interests.

What You’ll Be Doing: :

    • Working as part of a multi-discipline team of highly skilled engineers, technicians, surveyors, and drafters to provide excellent service to our clients
    • Conducting laboratory soil testing including wash sieve analysis, modified and standard proctors
    • Conducting laboratory concrete testing including compressive strength of concrete cylinders
    • Conducting laboratory asphalt testing, marshall properties
    • Conducting field testing of concrete (slump, air content, cast cylinders).
    • Conducting field compaction testing using a nuclear densometer
    • Timely preparation of reports
    • Other duties as required

What You’ll Bring:
    • Prior experience with earthworks/concrete construction and an interest in construction technology
    • A diploma in Civil Engineering Technology is an asset, but not required
    • Canadian Council of Independent Laboratories (CCIL)/American Concrete Institution (ACI) certification or the ability to obtain certification
    • Knowledge of Canadian Standards Association (CSA) and American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM) testing methods would be considered an asset
    • Physical ability to lift heavy equipment, willing to work in various environmental conditions with varied terrain, able to work in wildlife populated areas and willing to work in remote areas when needed
    • Good attitude and willingness to work cooperatively as a team player
    • Strong communication skills and leadership capabilities.

What Can We Offer You?:
    • Flexible work hours to accommodate your lifestyle
    • Great benefits, including extended health & dental coverage, healthcare spending account, & RRSP matching
    • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
    • Competitive salary and participation in our generous Performance Bonus Plan
    • Financial assistance with relocation if applicable
    • Opportunity to become a shareholder in an employee-owned firm
    • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
    • Continuous support for your professional development and growth
    • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone
    • Participation in our numerous programs that support our Four Cornerstones: people & communities, clients & partners, processes & technology, and financial.

About McElhanney:

Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose: Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.:

#LI-AM3 #Junior #Hybrid
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers: to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.

McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Lands Governance Director
description:
About Musqueam
We are traditional hən̓q̓əmin̓əm̓ speaking people. Today, we are a strong, growing community of over 1,300 members. We live on a small portion of our traditional territory, known as the Musqueam Indian Reserve, located south of Marine Drive near the mouth of the Fraser River. The name Musqueam relates back to the River Plant, the name of the plant is məθkʷəy̓. There is a story that has been passed on from generation to generation that explains how we became known as the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam) - People of the River Plant. We have always moved throughout our territory using the resources it provides for fishing, hunting, trapping and gathering. We remain distinct and our cultural practices are strong, despite the devastating impacts of residential schools, colonial laws banning our ceremonies, and other attempts to assimilate our people. Our lands and waters continue to support our cultural and economic practices while serving as a source of knowledge and memory, encoded with our teachings and laws. To learn more about Musqueam, please visit www.musqueam.bc.ca

Position Summary:
The MIB Land Governance Director administers interests in Musqueam land and natural resources consistent with the Land Code and related agreements. The MIB Land Governance Director is responsible for the comprehensive management of the MIB Lands Office and Land Registry relating to the Reserve lands under delegated authority from Council for the Musqueam Indian Band. The incumbent manages all aspects of the MIB Lands Office including supervision of lands staff and development of the annual departmental budget, work plans and policies and procedures. The MIB Land Governance Director reports to the CAO.

Key Relationships
  • MIB Land Management Committee for scope of responsibility and provision of advice on land issues and activities
  • MIB Council for funding the land program
  • Lands Advisory Board for technical support and provision of operations funding
  • Provincial land and natural resources authorities to ensure regulatory compatibility with respect to the environment and natural resource management
  • Contract staff with respect to surveys, legal issues, economic development, etc.
  • Administrative staff for revenue management and program interface
  • First Nations Land Registrar to ensure accuracy of records
Activities & Deliverables

Set up of the MIB Land Governance Office
Create initial budget and consolidated workplan
Develop annual budget and consolidated workplan for next fiscal year
Create policy and procedures to be approved by Chief & Council (land registry forms, registry fees, etc.)
Connect and develop relationship with local municipality; work together on future projects and or service agreements
Ensure the council, lands staff & lands committee are covered liability insurance

Supervise the staff within the MIB Lands Governance Office - Lands staff
  • Assist and give advice to the Lands staff on individual projects
  • Provide training to the Lands staff in the area of estates, leasing/permitting, individual land holdings, etc.
  • Maintain budgets for lands staff and lands committee; review budget on a monthly basis
  • Ensure Lands staff is connected to the FNLRS and receive training
  • Conduct staff evaluations, both probationary & regular annual evaluations based on individual performance work plans
  • Hold regular team meetings
MIB Land Code Committee (LCC)
  • Ensure Chief & Council establish LCC in accordance with Land Code
  • Develop Terms of Reference (TOR) as outlined in Land Code for review and approval by Chief & Council
  • Ensure Committee reviews TOR & signs Oath
Carry out the core functions and responsibilities under the MIB Land Code
  • Ensure all tasks under the areas of individual land holdings, leases/permits including monitoring and compliance, lands research and encumbrance checks, land estates and other land issues are completed and registered in the FNLRS, as required
  • Promote the Land Governance Office to local realtors, lawyers, bankers and developers via workshops, brochures, website, participating on boards, trade shows/display booths
  • Produce annual report for next fiscal year
  • Develop Laws based on Land Code and community priority
Knowledge Sharing
  • Work with LABRC and other FNLM First Nations on networking and sharing of best practices
Wills and Estates
  • Coordinate educational materials & workshops for Wills and Estates
Professional Development
  • Participate in Lands related workshops, courses and training sessions
Land Code Review
  • Review land code on an annual basis for potential amendments including updated clauses from other land codes or the LABRC
Duties & Responsibilities
  • Carries out all responsibilities of the MIB Land Governance Director as set out in the Musqueam Indian Band Land Code
  • Reviews and processes land lease agreements (residential, commercial, retail, industrial agreements), subleases, permits, rights of way, additions to Reserve proposals, allotments, transfers, mortgages, etc., and other legal documentation pertaining the Musqueam Indian Band Reserve lands
  • Provides guideline information as to the process for a proponent to register a lease or permit on Reserve lands
  • Oversees registrations in the First Nations Lands Registry System and Land Registry searches for membership and clients
  • Communicates with lessees and Band membership on land and land use issues, and with trustees, executors, and solicitors on land disposition
  • Assists and provides information to Chief & Council on land and land use issues
  • Where appropriate facilitate processing of estates and communication with AANDC about land estates
  • Approves all documentation as to form under the Land Code prior to registration
  • Monitors compliance with contractual terms, including construction, environmental requirements, rent collection, default and cancellation of leases
  • Facilitate rent reviews for leases and permits on Musqueam Indian Band lands and monitors collection made on behalf of the lessees
  • Facilitates compliance with environmental review requirements set out in the Land Code
  • Researches, verifies and compiles land status reports on Reserve lands for distribution to Natural Resources Canada, land surveyors (training is ongoing and as required), membership, clients and interested parties in order for them to determine land tenure, accessibility and feasibility of a land transaction
  • Develops and maintains effective working relationships with colleagues, the Land Management Committee, and agencies
  • Works closely with the Musqueam Indian Band Land Management Committee on Land Code and Reserve land matters
  • Oversees and monitors Lands Governance Office expenditures in accordance with the approved budget
  • Supervises MIB Land Governance Office staff
  • Conducts annual staff evaluations
  • Performs other duties as assigned
Authority & Confidentiality
  • Information: access to all land information from the Band and the Lands Advisory Board
  • Implementation of land laws not addressed by provision of the Land Code
  • May hold delegated authorities from the Musqueam Indian Band Council according to the Musqueam Land Code
  • The Land Governance Director is expected to be familiar and comply with the expectations of confidentiality as outlined in the Musqueam Indian Band Policy Manual and in the Privacy legislation
Knowledge & Skills Required

The work requires the following knowledge, skill and/or abilities:
  • Skill and knowledge usually attained by successful completion of a Post-Secondary degree or certificate program in administration, community planning, lands and resource management or related disciplines, and at least 3 years’ experience managing Reserve lands, or an equivalent combination of skill, knowledge and experience
  • Successful completion of the Lands Management Certificate Program or similar course in an accredited program would be preferred
  • Training or experience in developing and managing budgets
  • Considerable high-level contacts within federal, provincial and municipal governments, other First Nations organizations, funding agencies, banks and in the non-profit sector
  • Knowledge and experience of similar program delivery in the context of First Nations culture and history
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Excellent knowledge and experience in computers
  • Ability to use tact and good judgment in dealing with sensitive and complex issues
  • Ability to maintain strict confidentiality
  • Willingness to travel for meetings on occasion
Working Conditions:
  • Work is performed in an office environment
  • Availability to work flexible hours and to travel, as needed
  • Valid Driver’s License
  • Successful Criminal Record Check
Compensation:
  • $80-$90,000 per annum
  • Generous benefits and pension
Show more

title: Senior Surveyor
description:
DOF Subsea is a leading provider of subsea services offering the world’s offshore energy producers integrated offshore services from a single company around the world. With world class Subsea services (Remote Operated Vehicles and Survey), Marine services with a fleet of offshore construction vessels, and renewable services including floating offshore wind, the group combines expertise and technology to deliver integrated solutions.

DOF Subsea Canada is currently seeking a detailed oriented and client focused individual for the position of Senior Surveyor. A key to success for this position is the ability to collaborate with offshore and onshore personnel. The Party Chief will report to the Project Manager. If you are looking for a dynamic environment to learn and grow your career, DOF Subsea Canada is a great opportunity!


Key Responsibilities

  • Supervising checking and testing of survey equipment and software prior to project
  • Coordinating the mobilisation of survey equipment and software on vessels.
  • Must have a full understanding of the flow of data from the calibration at the project mobilization, through the logging and quality control of all data.
  • Implement and maintain survey standards throughout offshore operations.
  • A full appreciation of the survey deliverables is required so that on completion of a project, all data will be backed up and submitted to the Project Manager/Onshore team in the agreed DOF Subsea formats.
  • Development of project procedures and assist in project preparation.
  • Assist with management of day-to-day field operations. Responsible for the fulfilment of the contractual requirements regarding recording, quality, and accuracy of field data. In addition, be responsible for performing the fieldwork as economically as possible, taking into account the requirements of both the Client and DOF Subsea.
  • Ensure that all survey equipment in use has been calibrated and that the relevant calibration procedures are complied with. It includes checking that the correct calibration values are in use and that any relevant documentation is kept up to date.
  • Ensure that the collection of data is in accordance with ‘good survey practice’ and approved procedures and instructions. Ensure that the quality of data is consistent and of a proper standard. Monitor real-time displays, and examine calibration and data plots and charts/maps.
  • Management of project work scope and adhering to the contractual aspects of the project offshore.
  • Provide guidance and supervise the Offshore survey team
  • Ensure all personnel meet the company requirements for operational capability, competence, health, and safety.
  • Communicate, on a daily basis, with the Party Chief.
  • Liaising with client representatives and senior vessel/ROV crew.
  • Accountable for delegation of responsibility in accordance with company procedures, when appropriate.
  • Must complete daily/end of project reporting.
  • Responsible for Offshore QHSE.

Liaise with the Party Chief to ensure a complete understanding of the commercial impact of all decisions made offshore.

Qualifications and Experience:

Education:

Post Secondary Education in Subsea studies with a concentration in Oil & Gas, renewables

Hydrographic Survey or Geomatics degree or similar education

(Experience can compensate for lack of formal competency.)



Experience / Knowledge:

At least 5 years of experience as a Surveyor

Key experience in acting Senior Surveyor or Senior Surveyor duties

Proficiency in Microsoft Packages - Word/Excel/PowerPoint and Document Control Systems

Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills

Excellent communicator, reader, and writer.

Leadership Communication

(Training programme can compensate for lack of experience.)


*DOF Subsea Canada is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and equitable workplace. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply*

Show more

title: Clinical Informatics, Quality Accreditation Specialist
description:
Position name:

Clinical Informatics, Quality Accreditation Specialist (22-068)

Union/Non-Uniont:

Non-Union

Status:

Full-time

Supervisor:

CFO

Posted Date:

May 4 2022 12:00AM

Deadline:

May 15 2022 12:00AM

Overview:

The Alexandra Marine and General Hospital (AMGH) is a fully accredited healthcare organization located in the beautiful community of Goderich on the shores of Lake Huron. AMGH is the largest provider of acute care hospital services in Huron County. With an annual budget of $25M, AMGH offers a range of services including 24-hour emergency, intensive care, obstetrics, general surgery, inpatient adult psychiatry and multi site community mental health. The organization hosts a comprehensive range of specialty and regional healthcare services such as a renal dialysis satellite and telestroke site.


The South Huron Hospital Association (SHHA) was established in 1953 and serves a wide catchment area, including the Municipality of South Huron and its adjacent communities. Located in a small, rural community, we are proud to offer a 24/7 Emergency Department. With 19 inpatient beds, we provide acute, rehabilitation, and complex continuing inpatient care. Our outpatient services encompass the continuum of care as we strive to meet the evolving needs of our patients and surrounding communities.


Qualifications:

  • Degree in a relevant field of study, OR a combination of education and experience in a related field.
  • CPHIMS-CA certification is a strong asset.
  • Certification in Quality Improvement, Process Optimization, and / or LEAN principles is a strong asset.
  • Certification in Project Management or related courses is a strong asset.
  • Minimum 3 years recent related experience and/or 2 years in clinical informatics. Prior experience in a Clinical capacity is strongly desired.
  • Demonstrated prior experience leading and managing continuous quality improvement and patient safety initiatives is a strong asset.
  • Demonstrated prior experience planning, implementing, and managing quality and/or informatics projects is a strong asset.
    Prior experience with Accreditation Canada and associated standards an asset(Qmentum) standards, Required Organizational Practices, survey tools, and other Accreditation practices is a strong asset.
    Demonstrated experience facilitating change in a healthcare environment.
    Demonstrated thorough understanding of Hospital Information Systems. Experience with both Cerner and Meditech highly desired. Must be able to work with the Microsoft Windows and Office suite of software.
    Demonstrated experience with data analysis, data manipulation, report generation is an asset.
  • Current Police Check/Vulnerable Sector Screen and immunization status required upon hire.

Required Skills:

Position Description:

The dual site Clinical Informatics, Quality & Accreditation Specialist will liaise with the clinical areas of both organizations to support clinical applications and support continuous quality improvement. Championing clinical technology, health informatics and information systems as tools to facilitate safe, high-quality patient care, the Clinical Informatics, Quality & Accreditation Specialist will be responsible for the implementation and ongoing support of clinical applications. ing their knowledge of clinical practice standards, quality improvement, Accreditation standards and legislative compliance, the Clinical Informatics, Quality & Accreditation Specialist will drive continuing quality initiatives in alignment with the organization's strategic goals, ensuring that Accreditation objectives are fulfilled. The responsibilities of the Clinical Informatics Specialist will include:

1: Application Implementation and Support:

  • Facilitates the integration between clinical areas and IT with respect to the development and translation of business or clinical needs, using the appropriate reporting tools and methodologies.
  • Coordinates communication between the end user, Information Technology, system administrators, vendors and management in order to identify system needs, modifications and/or issue system upgrades, new software testing, and implementation.
  • Collaborates with clinical representatives to map the workflow processes in partnership with stakeholders to ensure the success of and optimization of new or modified clinical information systems.
  • Participates in (or delegates to end users as appropriate) performance testing exercises in conjunction with super users and the ITS Performance team.
  • Logs, tracks, escalates, and facilitates resolution of system issues, and communicates with user to ensure appropriate understanding and acceptance of solution.
  • In collaboration with other key stakeholders, may perform Proof of Concept "builds" and demonstrate same for approval/modification.
  • Identifies opportunities for extension of production systems to meet new or changing client needs.
  • Trains, educates, and instructs clinical users on features, operation, and usage of software systems.
  • Assists as needed to populate and maintain project education domains.
  • Works collaboratively with other Educators to design, lead, and facilitate program education.
  • Works with users to recommend system configuration modification to support evolving client needs.
  • Working in collaboration with IT, ensures technology solutions function optimally within the integrated suite of relevant applications.
  • Assists clinical areas/users in implementing new technology and transitioning from project implementation stage to the new current state.
  • Working in collaboration with Decision Support, monitors and validates data submissions to stakeholders.
  • Identifies trends in incorrect data capture. Educates staff on correct procedures, coding, and rationale.
  • Maintains current knowledge base, augmented by keeping abreast of new technologies in the field of clinical informatics and associated software.


2: Process Improvement and Quality:

  • Consults with stakeholders throughout the hospital, medical centres, and other programs to identify and recommend needs for technology solutions.
  • Advances patient safety and quality through knowledge of:
  • Clinical best practices,
  • Strategic priorities and operating goals,
  • Continuous Quality Improvement principles,
  • Legislative requirements,
  • Accreditation standards, and
  • Related policies.


  • Acts as a change agent by identifying process improvement opportunities supporting patient focused care, quality outcomes, and point of service decision-making.
  • Manages or participates in projects and initiatives designed to promote patient safety and quality improvement on a corporate-wide, program-wide and unit scale.
  • Provides leadership, guidance, planning and advocacy for clinical standardization through patient safety and quality improvement initiatives. Facilitates the integration between clinical areas and IT with respect to the development and translation of business or clinical needs, using the appropriate reporting tools and methodologies.
  • Assists in the selection and analysis of quality-related performance indicators to monitor and advance organizational, program, and/or unit level performance to ensure alignment with strategic direction.
  • Utilizes information systems data to plan, monitor and evaluate aspects of departmental performance; identify deviations and trends; plan and implement effective action to strengthen performance.
  • Directs, facilitates, and coordinates identification of opportunities based on:
  • consultation with stakeholders,
  • needs assessments,
  • performance metrics, and
  • strategic priorities,
to strengthen departmental/program performance, improve system outcomes, mitigate risks and enhance the staff and patient experience.
  • Ensures that Quality Improvement projects are aligned with the organization’s strategic priorities and operating goals.
  • Reports errors, omissions, or issues pertaining to quality as appropriate for tracking and improvement. Supports Leaders in investigation as necessary.

3: Accreditation:

  • In collaboration with partners and stakeholders, develops an annual work plan aligned with the Enabling Technology Plan with measurable goals and objectives.
  • Conducts preparatory activities pertaining to Accreditation assessment, including (but not limited to) the following:
    • Identifying parties whose partnership will be necessary.
    • Consulting with stakeholders regarding their roles and accountabilities.
    • Collecting data on the current state of the organization.
    • Acquiring access to the Accreditation portal and reviewing content therein.
    • Developing and establishing benchmarks to measure current performance vs. Accreditation standards/expectations.
    • Thoroughly documenting all stages of Accreditation progress.
    • Estimating program needs and expenses.
    • Creating a “roadmap” to Accreditation completion, inclusive of milestones, measurables, and accountabilities.


  • Facilitates the completion of the Accreditation assessment, inclusive of (but not limited to) the following:
    • Monitoring progress on the “roadmap” to Accreditation and providing regular and timely reports, updates, and prompts to appropriate stakeholders.
    • Providing expertise and interpretation regarding Accreditation program standards.
    • Manages and maintains documents and files pertaining to Accreditation.
    • Advises CEO of any risks, barriers, or deficiencies to achieving the desired Accreditation result.
    • Serves as point-of-contact to the Qmentum Accreditation team. Responds to an questions from Qmentum or refers to the appropriate respondent. Assists Qmentum surveyors when on-site, including booking meeting space, etc.
  • Manages the post-Accreditation process, including (but not limited to) the following:
    • Reviews results of Accreditation with appropriate stakeholders.
    • Analyzes the resiliency and long-term sustainability of improvements to practices, processes and policies implemented as a result of Accreditation feedback.
    • Makes recommendations for future budgetary expenditures relating to Accreditation, if applicable.
    • Assists with the announcing of Accreditation results.
    • Ensures Accreditation-related files will be accessible and available to the appropriate parties in future.

4: Partnerships and Project work:

  • Maintains current knowledge base, augmented by keeping abreast of new technologies in the field of clinical informatics and associated software.
  • In collaboration with partners and stakeholders, develops an annual work plan aligned with the Enabling Technology Plan with measurable goals and objectives.
  • Involved in software application implementation projects. Participates in development and design, is responsible for monitoring daily task achievement, outcomes, and issues.
  • Assists with establishing and maintaining a structured schedule for ongoing initiatives.
  • Works with software application vendors to understand and influence future directions and functionality of the software, to continually meet user needs.
  • Delivers monthly reports that clearly communicate the results and/or progress of projects, ongoing clinical support and day-to-day work.

As part of the assessment process applicants may be required to complete a written and/or practical test
Personal information is collected under FIPPA and is used to determine eligibility for potential employment and if hired, the information collected may be incorporated into your personnel file and used and disclosed for the purpose of administering your employment.

AMGH is an equal opportunity employer. Accommodations are available for all parts of the recruitment process. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.

NOTE: Only those applicants selected for an interview will be notified.

title: Clinical Informatics, Quality and Accreditation Specialist
description:
Competition:

2022-25

Program:

Administration

Position Type:

Full-time

Start Date:

2022-05-03 10:15


Closing Date:

2022-05-15 23:59


Clinical Informatics, Quality & Accreditation Specialist


Full-time Position


Reports to: CFO


Internal / External posting


About The Alexandra Marine and General Hospital (AMGH):

The Alexandra Marine and General Hospital (AMGH) is a fully accredited healthcare organization located in the beautiful community of Goderich on the shores of Lake Huron. AMGH is the largest provider of acute care hospital services in Huron County. With an annual budget of $25M, AMGH offers a range of services including 24 hour emergency, intensive care, obstetrics, general surgery, inpatient adult psychiatry and multi site community mental health. The organization hosts a comprehensive range of specialty and regional healthcare services such as a renal dialysis satellite and telestroke site.

About The South Huron Hospital Association (SHHA):

The South Huron Hospital Association (SHHA) was established in 1953 and serves a wide catchment area, including the Municipality of South Huron and its adjacent communities.


Located in a small, rural community, we are proud to offer a 24/7 Emergency Department. With 19 inpatient beds, we provide acute, rehabilitation, and complex continuing inpatient care. Our outpatient services encompass the continuum of care as we strike to meet the evolving needs of our patients and surrounding communities.


Position Description:

The dual site Clinical Informatics, Quality & Accreditation Specialist will liaise with the clinical areas of both organizations to support clinical applications and support continuous quality improvement. Championing clinical technology, health informatics and information systems as tools to facilitate safe, high-quality patient care, the Clinical Informatics, Quality & Accreditation Specialist will be responsible for the implementation and ongoing support of clinical applications. Applying their knowledge of clinical practice standards, quality improvement, Accreditation standards and legislative compliance, the Clinical Informatics, Quality & Accreditation Specialist will drive continuing quality initiatives in alignment with the organization's strategic goals, ensuring that Accreditation objectives are fulfilled. The responsibilities of the Clinical Informatics Specialist will include:


1: Application Implementation and Support:

  • Facilitates the integration between clinical areas and IT with respect to the development and translation of business or clinical needs, using the appropriate reporting tools and methodologies.
  • Coordinates communication between the end user, Information Technology, system administrators, vendors and management in order to identify system needs, modifications and/or issue system upgrades, new software testing, and implementation.
  • Collaborates with clinical representatives to map the workflow processes in partnership with stakeholders to ensure the success of and optimization of new or modified clinical information systems.
  • Participates in (or delegates to end users as appropriate) performance testing exercises in conjunction with super users and the ITS Performance team.
  • Logs, tracks, escalates, and facilitates resolution of system issues, and communicates with user to ensure appropriate understanding and acceptance of solution.
  • In collaboration with other key stakeholders, may perform Proof of Concept "builds" and demonstrate same for approval/modification.
  • Identifies opportunities for extension of production systems to meet new or changing client needs.
  • Trains, educates, and instructs clinical users on features, operation, and usage of software systems.
  • Assists as needed to populate and maintain project education domains.
  • Works collaboratively with other Educators to design, lead, and facilitate program education.
  • Works with users to recommend system configuration modification to support evolving client needs.
  • Working in collaboration with IT, ensures technology solutions function optimally within the integrated suite of relevant applications.
  • Assists clinical areas/users in implementing new technology and transitioning from project implementation stage to the new current state.
  • Working in collaboration with Decision Support, monitors and validates data submissions to stakeholders.
  • Identifies trends in incorrect data capture. Educates staff on correct procedures, coding, and rationale.
  • Maintains current knowledge base, augmented by keeping abreast of new technologies in the field of clinical informatics and associated software.

2: Process Improvement and Quality:
  • Consults with stakeholders throughout the hospital, medical centres, and other programs to identify and recommend needs for technology solutions.
  • Advances patient safety and quality through knowledge of:
    • Clinical best practices,
    • Strategic priorities and operating goals,
    • Continuous Quality Improvement principles,
    • Legislative requirements,
    • Accreditation standards, and
    • Related policies.
  • Acts as a change agent by identifying process improvement opportunities supporting patient focused care, quality outcomes, and point of service decision-making.
  • Manages or participates in projects and initiatives designed to promote patient safety and quality improvement on a corporate-wide, program-wide and unit scale.
  • Provides leadership, guidance, planning and advocacy for clinical standardization through patient safety and quality improvement initiatives. Facilitates the integration between clinical areas and IT with respect to the development and translation of business or clinical needs, using the appropriate reporting tools and methodologies.
  • Assists in the selection and analysis of quality-related performance indicators to monitor and advance organizational, program, and/or unit level performance to ensure alignment with strategic direction.
  • Utilizes information systems data to plan, monitor and evaluate aspects of departmental performance; identify deviations and trends; plan and implement effective action to strengthen performance.
  • Directs, facilitates, and coordinates identification of opportunities based on:
    • consultation with stakeholders,
    • needs assessments,
    • performance metrics, and
    • strategic priorities,

    to strengthen departmental/program performance, improve system outcomes, mitigate risks and enhance the staff and patient experience.

  • Ensures that Quality Improvement projects are aligned with the organization’s strategic priorities and operating goals.
  • Reports errors, omissions, or issues pertaining to quality as appropriate for tracking and improvement. Supports Leaders in investigation as necessary.


3: Accreditation:
  • In collaboration with partners and stakeholders, develops an annual work plan aligned with the Enabling Technology Plan with measurable goals and objectives.
    • Conducts preparatory activities pertaining to Accreditation assessment, including (but not limited to) the following:
    • Identifiing parties whose partnership will be necessary.
    • Consulting with stakeholders regarding their roles and accountabilities.
    • Collecting data on the current state of the organization.
    • Aquiring access to the Accreditation portal and reviewing content therein.
    • Developing and establishing benchmarks to measure current performance vs. Accreditation standards/expectations.
    • Thoroughly documenting all stages of Accreditation progress.
    • Estimating program needs and expenses.
    • Creating a “roadmap” to Accreditation completion, inclusive of milestones, measurables, and accountabilities.
  • Facilitates the completion of the Accreditation assessment, inclusive of (but not limited to) the following:
    • Monitoring progress on the “roadmap” to Accreditation and providing regular and timely reports, updates, and prompts to appropriate stakeholders.
    • Providing expertise and interpretation regarding Accrediation program standards.
    • Manages and maintains documents and files pertaining to Accreditation.
    • Advises CEO of any risks, barriers, or deficiencies to achieving the desired Accreditation result.
    • Serves as point-of-contact to the Qmentum Accreditation team. Responds to an questions from Qmentum or refers to the appropriate respondent. Assists Qmentum surveyors when on-site, including booking meeting space, ec.
  • Manages the post-Accreditation process, including (but not limited to) the following:
    • Reviews results of Accreditation with appropriate stakeholders.
    • Analyzes the resiliency and long-term sustainability of improvements to practices, processes and policies implemented as a result of Accreditation feedback.
    • Makes recommendations for future budgetary expenditures relating to Accreditation, if applicable.
    • Assists with the announcing of Accreditation results.
    • Ensures Accreditation-related files will be accessible and available to the appropriate parties in future.


4: Partnerships and Project work:

  • Maintains current knowledge base, augmented by keeping abreast of new technologies in the field of clinical informatics and associated software.
  • In collaboration with partners and stakeholders, develops an annual work plan aligned with the Enabling Technology Plan with measurable goals and objectives.
  • Involved in software application implementation projects. Participates in development and design, is responsible for monitoring daily task achievement, outcomes, and issues.
  • Assists with establishing and maintaining a structured schedule for ongoing initiatives.
  • Works with software application vendors to understand and influence future directions and functionality of the software, to continually meet user needs.
  • Delivers monthly reports that clearly communicate the results and/or progress of projects, ongoing clinical support and day-to-day work.

Qualifications:

  • Degree in a relevant field of study, OR a combination of education and experience in a related field.
  • CPHIMS-CA certification is a strong asset.
  • Certification in Quality Improvement, Process Optimization, and / or LEAN principles is a strong asset.
  • Certification in Project Management or related courses is a strong asset.
  • Minimum 3 years recent related experience and/or 2 years in clinical informatics. Prior experience in a Clinical capacity is strongly desired.
  • Demonstrated prior experience leading and managing continuous quality improvement and patient safety initiatives is a strong asset.
  • Demonstrated prior experience planning, implementing, and managing quality and/or informatics projects is a strong asset.
    Prior experience with Accreditation Canada and associated standards an asset(Qmentum) standards, Required Organizational Practices, survey tools, and other Accreditation practices is a strong asset.
    Demonstrated experience facilitating change in a healthcare environment.
    Demonstrated thorough understanding of Hospital Information Systems. Experience with both Cerner and MediTech highly desired. Must be able to work with the Microsoft Windows and Office suite of software.
    Demonstrated experience with data analysis, data manipulation, report generation is an asset.
  • Current Police Check/Vulnerable Sector Screen and immunization status required upon hire.

Immunization Records: Successful candidates must provide evidence of fully completed COVID-19 vaccination status prior to your first day of work. Any candidate entering the facility to attend an interview will be required to provide evidence of a fully completed COVID-19 vaccination status. To be considered fully immunized, individuals need to have received their second dose of a COVID-19 vaccine at least 14 days earlier than the date they arriving to an interview or to begin work at SHHA.


We are committed to providing persons with disabilities equal opportunities regarding all employment activities, including access to jobs and accommodations during employment as required, in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC) and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Please advise the Human Resources department if you require accommodation.


Qualified individuals may submit a resume and covering letter in confidence via this website. Applications without cover letters will not be considered.


Your interest in this opportunity is appreciated. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Party Chief
description:
DOF Subsea is a leading provider of subsea services offering the world’s offshore energy producers integrated offshore services from a single company around the world. With world class Subsea services (Remote Operated Vehicles and Survey), Marine services with a fleet of offshore construction vessels, and renewable services including floating offshore wind, the group combines expertise and technology to deliver integrated solutions.

DOF Subsea Canada is currently seeking a detailed oriented and client focused individual for the position of Party Chief. A key to success for this position is the ability to collaborate with offshore and onshore personnel. The Party Chief will report to the Project Manager. If you are looking for a dynamic environment to learn and grow your career, DOF Subsea Canada is a great opportunity!

Requirements

Key Responsibilities

  • Supervising checking and testing of survey equipment and software prior to project
  • Coordinating and managing the mobilisation of survey equipment and software on vessels.
  • Must have a full understanding of the flow of data from the calibration at the project mobilization, through the logging and quality control of all data.
  • Implement and maintain survey standards throughout offshore operations.
  • A full appreciation of the survey deliverables is required so that on completion of a project, all data will be backed up and submitted to the Project Manager/Onshore team in the agreed DOF Subsea formats.
  • Development of project procedures and assist in project preparation.
  • Management of project work scope and adhering to the contractual aspects of the project offshore.
  • Manage, provide guidance and supervise the Offshore survey team
  • Ensure the work is performed with adequate equipment and personnel.
  • Ensure all personnel meet the company requirements for operational capability, competence, health, and safety.
  • Communicate, on a daily basis, with the Project Manager.
  • Liaising with client representatives and senior vessel/ROV crew.
  • Manage subcontractor’s field team.
  • Responsible for carrying out offshore appraisals and encouraging / ensuring team development.
  • Accountable for delegation of responsibility in accordance with company procedures, when appropriate.
  • Must complete daily/end of project reporting.
  • Responsible for Offshore QHSE.

Liaise with the Project Manager to ensure a complete understanding of the commercial impact of all decisions made offshore.

Qualifications and Experience:

Education:

Post Secondary Education in Subsea studies with a concentration in Oil & Gas, renewables

Hydrographic Survey or Geomatics degree or similar education

(Experience can compensate for lack of formal competency.)



Experience / Knowledge:

At least 3 years of experience as a Senior Surveyor

Key experience in acting Party Chief or Party Chief duties

Proficiency in Microsoft Packages - Word/Excel/PowerPoint and Document Control Systems

Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills

Excellent communicator, reader, and writer.

Incident Investigation & Reporting

Leadership Communication

(Training programme can compensate for lack of experience.)


*DOF Subsea Canada is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and equitable workplace. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply*

Show more

title: Project Controls Lead
description:
Project Controls Lead

Country/Region: CA
City: Victoria

Project Controls Lead (Permanent)

Victoria, BC


Underpinned by a deep understanding of technology integration, asset management, and specialist training, Babcock International works with customers around the world to improve the capability, reliability and availability of their most critical assets within the key market sectors of Marine, Land, Aviation, and Nuclear.


In Canada, Babcock works in the Marine sector, where our teams provide critical and complex support to Canada’s submarine fleet. Our Canadian team is proud to be trusted to deliver key naval in-service support for the Royal Canadian Navy. We also operate in the Aviation sector, where Babcock ensures that the aircrew trainees of our partner nations receive the world’s best flying training. We deliver vital aerial emergency services and are proud to have been selected by the Government of Manitoba to deliver their wildfire suppression services, as well as key components of their critical air ambulance services. As well, we have expanded into the Canadian Nuclear Energy Industry. Cavendish Nuclear, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Babcock International Group, is a leading nuclear services company with a growing national and global presence. Drawing on over 60 years of nuclear experience, Cavendish Nuclear provides specialized service solutions in Canada, with global capabilities across the entire nuclear life cycle.

Whether it is providing technical training instruction, developing training materials or maintaining critical training assets, Babcock is trusted by its customers to deliver world-class training solutions.

Our business relies on our people delivering their best day in and day out. As individuals, we all make a difference to our colleagues, our customers and others who we interact with on a daily basis. Collectively at Babcock, our employees embody the ‘Being Babcock’ principles that help make us great at what we do:


  • Always strive to deliver
  • Build great relationships based on trust
  • Safeguard customers’ reputations
  • Never compromise on health and safety
  • Challenge ourselves and each other
  • Respect people and value their diversity
  • Thrive on complexity
  • Trust our people to deliver

We encourage you to explore our Babcock Canada website to learn more about us at www.babcockcanada.com.


In this role, you will:

  • Report directly to the Project Controls Manager and provide project control services for production and design-based Waterfront projects
  • Contribute to Project Control process improvements and development of processes and procedures for new Waterfront projects
  • Implement best practice Project Controls in accordance with Babcock procedures and commercial arrangements
  • Responsible for managing, and keeping alignment between schedule, progress, cost, planning and change management databases
  • Responsible for weekly earned value management reporting, analysis, and communication
  • Develop and maintain suite of project control metrics and reports used for briefing internal and external stakeholders
  • Provide accurate and effective management information to support KPI reporting
  • Ensure production of accurate project, programme and operational reporting in the required format and in accordance with required deadlines
  • Liaise with Babcock Finance to ensure all corporate financial reporting needs are supported and met by operations
  • Support to produce monthly project Estimate at Completion (EAC) and ad-hoc cost reporting requirements
  • Facilitate EAC reviews, comprehensive variance analysis and identification of trends and developing mitigations to address baseline variances
  • Produce ad-hoc forecasts and revised budgets as requested
  • Support in the management and administration of contractual changes
  • Support and facilitate project close out reporting requirements
  • Provide guidance and contribute in the development to project controls team members, including mentoring and coaching of junior staff
  • Liaise with operational management to provide project control support
  • Must effectively communicate with internal and external stakeholders
  • Attend customer and supplier meetings as required
  • Perform other duties as necessary

As our ideal candidate,


  • You hold a post-secondary degree in a Business, Construction Economics, Engineering, or a related discipline
  • Preferred post secondary qualifications as follows; Certified Cost Engineer (AACE's CCC/ CCE) Professional Quantity Surveyor (CIQS/RICS), and/or Project Management Professional credential (PMP) designation or equivalent
  • You have a minimum of 5 years experience in a lead project control role
  • You have a minimum of 2 years experience leading a team
  • You have a strong understanding of project controls and project management processes
  • You have intermediate to advanced Excel skills, good knowledge of MS Office and ERP systems (experience utilizing IFS is an asset)
  • You are able to plan, prioritise and deliver to firm deadlines
  • You are able to create and maintain strong relationships with key internal customers and stakeholders
  • You have exceptional attention to detail
  • Proof that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19, meaning that you must have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by the Government of Canada with the final dose at least 14 days prior to your start date
  • You are eligible for a Canadian Secret Security and ITAR Clearance

Applicants, please apply online at https://www.babcockinternational.com/careers/


Babcock Canada supports the safety and wellbeing of our employees through the following programs:

  • Contributions towards an employee’s physical and mental health
  • Wellness days
  • Supportive work life balance: flexible work schedule and competitive annual vacation time off
  • Comprehensive health and dental benefits
  • Pregnancy and Parental Leave top-up available
  • Employer matching of employee retirement contribution
  • Employee recognition and bonus programs
  • Support of professional development and reimbursement of membership dues
  • Relocation assistance for individuals and families

Babcock is committed to promoting a workforce without boundaries. One that welcomes everyone to contribute to our success regardless of race, nationality, colour, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability or age. If you require accommodation during any stage of our recruitment process, please let us know how we can assist you.
