title: Survey Technician
description:
Position:  Survey Technician

Location:  Calgary Branch Office

Organizational Information

TULLOCH Engineering is a progressive consulting firm that provides engineering, land surveying, environmental and mapping services.  We employ over 350 professionals working from fifteen offices throughout Canada.  The TULLOCH team is made up of individuals who love a challenge and are willing to go to remote work environments to get the job done.  If you are looking to try something new, consider joining our great team!

The geomatics team at TULLOCH offers services to private and government sector clients throughout Ontario and across Canada.  We provide a full range of traditional surveying services as well as construction monitoring, precision layout, and high-definition 3D laser scanning.   We are innovative in our approach and whenever possible utilize emerging technologies to improve both the efficiency and quality of deliverables to our clients.

We are currently looking for a full time Survey Technician to join our Calgary team. This is a permanent, full-time position to begin as soon as a successful candidate is found.  We view this position as one with potential for growth.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Organize equipment and supplies
  • Ensure all equipment is accounted for and maintained in good working order
  • Demonstrate the essential skills related to the use of all equipment used to perform job responsibilities
  • Assist in the collection of field data using various survey instruments, calculators, levels and GPS field equipment

Qualifications:

  • A college diploma from a Civil Engineering Technician or Technology program or equivalent experience considered an asset;
  • Minimum of 2 years experience in the survey field considered an asset;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills;
  • Excellent problem solving skills;
  • Proficient in the use of various survey instruments, calculators, levels and GPS field equipment or an aptitude to learn;
  • Ability to work in a team environment;
  • Ability to prioritize multiple projects and tasks in a fast paced environment;
  • Valid Alberta Driverâ€™s License; and,
  • Willing to travel for site inspections and field work.

 

Resumes should be sent to the Human Resources Department; submit online at www.tulloch.ca.  Thank you to all applicants for their interest. Only those candidates shortlisted for the position will be contacted. 

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process, or those needing job postings in an alternate format, may email a request to

hr@tulloch.ca

title: Technicien / Technicienne en arpentage
description:
Your Employer

Osez Englobe

 

Englobe, c’est plus de 2 600 personnes qui, au quotidien, se préoccupent de l’environnement, contribuent à des projets d’ingénierie durable, traitent les sols et la biomasse, et gèrent la qualité et l’intégrité des actifs.

 

Chez Englobe, nous adoptons une gestion novatrice centrée sur l’humain. Nous accueillons les nouvelles idées et sommes ouverts à la discussion. Nous sommes déterminés à réussir, en partenariat avec nos équipes.

 

Nous offrons

  • une gamme complète d’avantages sociaux (assurances collectives avec coûts partagés dès l’embauche, REER collectif);
  • un service de soins santé virtuels télémédecine;
  • un remboursement annuel des frais d’activités sportives;
  • des occasions de développement des compétences;
  • un horaire flexible et possibilité de comprimer les heures de travail;
  • une politique interne pour encourager le télétravail.

Osez Englobe et menez une carrière marquée par la croissance et les réalisations.


Your Contribution

Englobe recherche un technicien en arpentage pour son bureau de Québec afin de se joindre à l’équipe d’Ingénierie en infrastructure. Englobe offre des services de consultation en génie civil dans le cadre de la conception et la réalisation de projets routiers, de chaussées et d’infrastructure municipales depuis plus de 10 ans. À ce titre, vous serez appelé à participer à la conception et la réalisation de projets routiers, de chaussées et d’infrastructures municipales.

 

En tant que Technicien / Technicienne en arpentage, vous travaillerez en collaboration avec l'équipe de Génie municipal et urbain et vos principales responsabilités seront:

  • Effectuer les levés terrain à l'aide des équipements d'arpentage;
  • Effectuer des calculs de volumétrie;
  • Effectuer des opérations d’implantation sur des chantiers de construction;
  • Effectuer des relevés topographiques;
  • Déterminer des coordonnées géographiques précises au moyen de système de positionnement global (GPS) ;
  • Préparer les notes sur le terrain et les résultats attendus;
  • Vérifier si les différents travaux correspondent à l’implantation et aux plans et devis ;
  • Toutes autres tâches afférentes aux levé terrain et calculs en arpentage.

Your Profile

  • DEP/ AEC ou DEC en arpentage / géomatique ou connexe;
  • Capacité d’analyse de données;
  • Carte ASP Construction;
  • Posséder son permis de conduire et une voiture;
  • Capacité à travailler à l’extérieur en toute saison;
  • Avoir de l’expérience est un atout;
  • Capacité à travailler seul et en équipe;
  • Être méthodique et minutieux.
  • Démontrer un intérêt et une sensibilité envers la santé et la sécurité au travail.

Nous accueillons les nouvelles idées et sommes ouverts à la discussion. Nous sommes déterminés à réussir, en partenariat avec nos équipes.', 'Osez Englobe']

title: Survey Technician
description:
Survey Technician

Who we are

Englobe is distinguished by its wide range of services, its presence across Canada, its client satisfaction, and its customized approach with a wide range of services from consulting, turnkey project implementation and soil treatment facilities. Over the years, Englobe has acquired credibility and a reputation for people-centred values. DST Consulting Engineers Inc., a Division of Englobe, provides expert, innovative environmental and engineering consulting services - without surprises.

We offer
  • Full benefits package (group insurance with cost-sharing upon hiring, group RRSP after 3 months, the possibility of time banking)
  • Annual reimbursement of physical activity costs
  • Skills development opportunities
  • Reimbursement of travel expenses
  • Flextime and the possibility of a compressed schedule

We are currently seeking a Survey Technician to work out of our office in Waterloo, ON.

Responsibilities:
  • Perform job site surveys and instrumentation monitoring of civil engineering structures, building, utilities, roadways, railway tracks, and bridges
  • Install building, surface and in-ground survey monitoring points and other types of structural and geotechnical instrumentation at job sites.
  • Perform high-precision control surveys and baselines.
  • Complete calculations for structure and ground movement in the field and using data collector software.
  • Produce survey reports for Clients and construction project teams
  • Perform all aspects of construction and site surveying including layout, as-built, topographic, quantity, slope staking, grade staking, and various underground utility staking.
  • Work with another crewmate with a team mentality to produce a product and summary reports catered to the client's needs. Ensure crew members are working in a safe environment.
  • Manage and maintain survey equipment and instruments, survey data, and records
  • Perform pre-and post-construction condition surveys and assist with noise & vibration monitoring operations.

Qualifications:
  • Diploma of Collegial Studies or Degree in Surveying and Geomatics / Construction / Civil / Geotechnical / Engineering Geology
  • Minimum 2 years of experience dealing with road/highway construction.
  • In-depth knowledge of highway/structure surveying procedures.
  • Solid geometry/mathematical background.
  • Good knowledge of data collector software - Trimble Access & Survey Pro.
  • Competent with Trimble & Leica total stations and GPS.
  • Valid driver's licence.
  • Valid First Aid Level C-CPR & AED.
  • Ontario Land Surveyors license is considered an asset.

Englobe & DST adheres to employment equity and equal opportunity programs and encourages all women, visible minorities, Aboriginals, and disabled persons to apply.

Only selected candidates will be contacted.

How to apply
Please forward your resume and cover letter to humanresources@dstgroup.com, and please quote Job # 21-1233

title: Surveyor
description:
Surveyor









Location: Calgary, AB, Canada Job ID: R9801 Job Status: Full-Time



Share:











Apply Now



Ledcor Employee? Apply internally in Workday.













Description





Job Summary:

You are an experienced Surveyor seeking a great wage, extensive benefits, and want to work for a company who prides themselves on safety. You have previously worked alongside crews within an industrial environment.


Apply to join the Ledcor team today!







Essential Responsibilities:



+ Complete field survey requests, measurements, and setup / configuring survey instruments.


+ Comfortable working with crews and proficient at communication.


+ Establish secondary control from primary site control networks.


+ Interpret and extrapolate surveying data from construction and design drawings.


+ Install survey stake locations, such as Right of Way limits, pile locations and cut-offs, and site grading.


+ Prepare surveying notes, level notes, grade sheets, and calculate coordinates.





Qualifications:



+ Minimum 3 years of field Surveying experience


+ Preferred to have completed diploma in Surveying, Geomatics, Civil Engineering, or a related field


+ Technical background in surveying, using conventional & digital levels, robotic total stations (Leica), and Trimble GPS equipment


+ Proficient with Trimble Access and Leica Captivate


+ Attention to detail with the ability to recognize & communicate discrepancies


+ Must be able to complete pre-access Drug and Alcohol testing





Work Conditions:



+ Shift based role of 14/7, camp and travel provided


+ Work will be primarily outdoors in various weather conditions


+ Benefits provided by CLAC - extended health plan (prescription drugs, dental, and other coverage)





Additional Information:


Company Description


Ledcor Industrial offers an integrated range of services from construction, engineering, and maintenance to pipe fabrication and module assembly. We offer turnkey solutions to our oil and gas clients and have built some of the continent’s largest oil and gas projects.




But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!




Employment Equity


At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.



Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging.




View our full Inclusion & Diversity statement here (https://www.ledcor.com/who-we-are/inclusion-and-diversity) .



Date Posted

May 5, 2022



1930 Maynard Road SE, Calgary, AB, Canada

title: Survey Crew Chief
description:
At GeoVerra, itâ€™s about more than surveying land. Joining our team means youâ€™ll step into a career with wide-open opportunities. Experience new places, challenges that grow you, and a dynamic pace of work in which two days are never the same. If youâ€™re most at home in the outdoorsâ€”where fresh air, towering trees and occasional wildlife become your second-favourite coworkersâ€”then our Survey Crew Chief position located in Virden, Manitoba might be the perfect fit.

Our company is in acceleration mode. GeoVerraâ€™s growth is based on real partnerships, and we credit it to the people and culture that make us who we are to set us apart. In fact, your career here will be unique to you, and thatâ€™s how we like it. We value your sharp skills, creative mind, and technical brain.

The most important thing to know? Weâ€™re a team of experienced and professional employees who genuinely believe in the work we do. We support each other in a safe and positive working environment. At GeoVerra, you never go at it alone. Dig deeper. Broaden your horizons. Weâ€™re here for it all. And with fantastic benefits, work-life balance, and professional development options, we make it easier to chase your dreams.

The Partnership Promise
This is our commitment to provide responsive, trustworthy, industry expertise and a solutions-oriented approach to our clients, but we extend this way of thinking in all we do. It shows up in the form of work ethic, teamwork, safety and support for our GeoVerra family.

You GeoVerra
Our new Survey Crew Chief must be passionate about spending time in the field. Whether you have a technical background or love exploring every nook and cranny outside, you should have
an unquenchable thirst for seeing and doing it all.

This position requires a quick and engaged learner, with proven success in adaptability, productivity and high physical capabilities. Ideally, you are organized and highly collaborative, with strong communication skills and an infectious positivity that encourages this attitude in all team members. You will have a strong handle on equipment and field tools, with a healthy respect for the outdoors and the timeline of
the task at hand.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and perform field survey work;
  • Liaise with Project Managers to coordinate field survey work, to review and manage project budgets, timeline requirements, priorities and survey methodology;
  • Act as a company representative, liaising directly with client field representatives and land owners;
  • Prepare and communicate field notes, sketches, checklists and digital data in required formats for Project Managers, Land Surveyors and Drafting personnel;
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to Survey Assistants working with you;
  • Contribute to the development and implementation of industry best practices, more efficient field processes and procedures and the innovative use of new technology; 
  • Actively participate in and proactively support the advancement of the GeoVerra safety program;
  • Some office technical survey work may be required in this position; and
  • Other duties as assigned/required

Qualifications

  • Our successful candidate will be a graduate of a recognized post-secondary program related to surveying and geomatics or have an equivalent amount of related experience.  
  • 1 years experience;
  • Strong working knowledge of survey equipment and software such as GPS and Total Stations (Including Robotic);
  • Knowledge and experience of Trimble equipment and software, laser scanning and line locating would be considered an asset;
  • Strong problem-solving skills in a field environment;
  • Effective communication skills - verbal and written; ability to produce accurate and legible field notes;
  • The ability to develop and motivate survey staff and work well in a team environment;
  • An aptitude for delivering projects on time and budget;
  • Experience with the use of ATVs/UTVs, snowmobiles and chainsaws would be considered an asset;
  • A valid Class 5 driverâ€™s license and can provide a clean driverâ€™s abstract;
  • Completed training and valid tickets in First Aid, H2S and CSTS safety training, is an asset.
  • All employment offers for Safety Sensitive positions are conditional upon the successful completion of a Negative Drug Screen and Passing Alcohol Screen. 

Timeline
Full time, beginning immediately
 

At this time GeoVerra does not mandate COVID-19 vaccine for employees. With that, many GeoVerra clients have incorporated proof of vaccine practices due to COVID-19 and this may require you to provide proof of immunization when accessing their sites.

GeoVerra has every intention of fostering diversity within and across our organization. We welcome those who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff including, but not limited to, women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.

title: Survey Technologist
description:
Role Overview
McElhanney is currently seeking an experienced and motivated individual to join our team as a Survey Technologist in Vancouver, BC. This is a great opportunity for a dedicated individual who is looking to gain hands on surveying experience with a multidisciplinary team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work alongside a team of survey technicians and land surveyors on a variety of legal, topographic and construction surveys.

Responsibilities
  • Interpret field data in order to create accurate survey drawings and legal plans, which will include downloading and editing field data, interpreting field notes and sketches, and processing conventional and GPS data
  • Complete calculations as needed and prepare for drafting or client project reporting
  • Liaising with Project Managers and clients regarding enquiries and issues
  • Implementing and ensuring quality assurance on all field returns
  • Maintain, test, calibrate and adjust survey equipment as needed
  • Take instructions from the project manager for performance of office tasks.
  • Coordinate the preparation of documents and applications required for regulatory approvals.

Requirements
  • Degree or technical diploma in Geomatics with at least 2 years’ of progressive experience in a survey tech/party chief role; experience in legal and engineering surveys is a strong asset  
  • BCLS accreditation or working towards accreditation is an asset
  • Experience with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey and Leica Geo Office is an asset
  • Knowledge of survey and boundary calculation, geodetic coordinate systems and map projections
  • Capable of computations and assessment of found legal evidence in the field when necessary
  • Understanding of the BC Land Titles system
  • Strong communication, leadership, and motivational skills

This role is designated as a safety sensitive position.

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.
#LI-AM3   #junior  #Hybrid

If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 
For more than 100 years, we’ve been an industry leader in the application of leading practices and cutting-edge technology within Surveying and Geomatics. Our survey crews and technical employees are committed to working closely with our clients in the resource, infrastructure, and construction industries, and within the communities we help build.
McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Field Surveyor
description:
The Field Surveyor would be responsible for daily scheduling and evaluating of the survey work during the performance of all survey projects. This would be on the Broadway Extension project in Vancouver. This would be an opportunity to be a part of a huge infrastructure project that will have an effect on the way people commute.


Advantages
opportunity to work on large, high profile projects with a civil contractor that has opportunities all over the world

Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Take instructions from the Survey Manager for performance of field and office tasks
Take instruction from his main leader (Surveyor Senior), if working in team.
Perform on-site liaison between project manager and client as required from time to time
Perform computations of survey data
Manage flow of information between field and office, and prepare clear, concise and accurate field notes, records.
Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety and policy compliance
Principles of land surveying and mapping, boundary analysis, right of way mapping and standard surveying practices (field and/or office).
Reading and interpreting plans, maps, legal descriptions, survey field data and records.
Directs the use of and if necessary, operates the various types of survey equipment
Use and application of Computer Aided Design and Drafting software (CAD).
Other related duties as assigned from time to time.


Qualifications
2-year technical diploma in Geomatics with 3 years’ experience in industrial and construction surveying projects
Experience in AutoCAD, CIVIL3D, TBC (Trimble Business Center)
Demonstrated experience in Leica Tools
Proficiency in computer and survey software applications
Valid driver’s license


Summary
If this sounds like something you would be interested in please feel free to send me a copy of your resume to patrick.stegner@randstad.ca

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Surveyor
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview

The successful candidate will become part of a construction team in Saskatoon focused on Municipal and Commercial projects such as Roadbuilding, Concrete Restoration, Asphalt Resurfacing and Parking Lot Construction.

Responsibilities

Safety Responsibilities:

  • Daily safety documentation 
  • Participate in tool box talks
  • Safety Training as needed 

Daily Responsibilities:

  • Work directly with superintendents, estimators, project managers and foremen ensuring all are informed of project requirements, timelines, and obligations regarding GPS performance
  • Use of AutoCad, Civil 3D, and Topcon software to build surfaces for use in 3D Machine Control
  • Interim and final quantities
  • Attain and compile data for use of machine control GPS
  • Monthly project progressing
  • Monitor quantities using GPS
  • Upload, maintain and troubleshoot GPS systems in Graders, Dozers, and Skidsteers
  • Checking grades and survey layout  
  • Aid field staff using 3D machine control
  • Utilize transit level to layout elevation data
  • File Management
  • Monitor and track project costs
  • Preliminary Survey

 

Qualifications

  • 2-3 years experience in surveying
  • Education in Geomatics Technology is an asset

Daily Work Details:

  • Work locations are in and around Saskatoon and will vary during the construction season
  • Start dates vary depending on spring conditions and work usually concludes in mid-November.

Pay & Benefits:

  • Offering competitive wages as well as health and dental.  RRSP matching available after probation period.

 

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Land Survey Party Chief
description:
Company Description

We are a global team of dedicated and experienced architects, engineers, planners, designers and technology professionals who share a common desire – to help our clients create livable, sustainable, and advanced urban environments.

Job Description

Our Edmonton office is seeking a Land Survey Party Chief who is looking to grow their career. We are seeking someone who is a quick learner and a team player who will be an integral part of our geomatics and surveying group. On a regular basis, managers have touch base meetings with their teams to discuss the progress of projects or any issues that they have encountered. We continue to emphasize wellness for all our team members and have added to our comprehensive list of benefits to support this further.

Most of the things you'll work on:

Responsibilities:

  • Legal surveys of subdivisions, condominiums, stratas, and real property reports.
  • Construction survey layout of building foundations, deep, shallow and surface utility services, landscape surface features and lot grade staking.
  • Topographic and site as-built surveys
  • Drone operation and flight planning preparation for aerial site surveys
  • Work primarily within Edmonton and surrounding areas, outdoors in all seasons and weather conditions
  • Willing and able to travel out of town when the need arises
  • Operation of ATV’s and misc. power tools
  • Follow safety protocol
  • Provide guidance and training to survey assistants
  • Prepare clear, concise, and accurate field notes, records, and calculations
Qualifications

You'll need to have:

  • A degree/diploma from a technical college in Geomatics
  • Certifications in First AID, ATV operations and Drone operation are assets
  • Experience with Trimble Survey products/software
  • Experience leading a construction and/or legal survey crew
  • Ability to read/examine Survey and Engineering plans
  • Experience performing precise layout and control surveys
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • The ability to liaise effectively with clients
  • Must have a Valid Class 5 Canadian Driver's Licence and own reliable vehicle along with commercial insurance (in which compensation will be provided for vehicular usage)


Additional Information

Why you should work for IBI Group:

Our employees will find a design environment where collaboration is at the core of the business. We proudly support our team members through continuing education, completion of licenses and certifications, memberships in professional societies, seminar and conference attendance.

  • Competitive Base Salary based on industry standards
  • Robust Extended Medical Benefits
  • Participation in Incentives Program
  • Coverage of Licensing Fees and Annual Dues to Professional Organizations
  • Professional Development & Self-Directed Learning Resources

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. IBI Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include:  work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.

title: Arpenteur(se)-géomètre coordonnateur(trice)
description:
Venez faire une différence dans une ville moderne, en pleine expansion, qui a à cœur ses citoyens. Un milieu où votre créativité contribue à la réalisation de grands projets stimulants favorisant le mieux-être des Lavallois. En plus de vous offrir des possibilités de carrière, vous ferez partie d’une grande organisation publique à dimension humaine. Le Centre d’Excellence en géomatique est à la recherche d’un(e) :

Arpenteur(se)- géomètre coordonnateur(trice)

Mandat temporaire (1 an)

Les défis qui vous attendent :

Sous l’autorité du supérieur immédiat, vous planifiez, organisez et dirigez l’exécution des activités reliées à l’arpentage foncier y compris l’emplacement des limites de propriétés. De plus, vous coordonnez les mandats confiés à des firmes d’arpenteurs-géomètres, développez les devis techniques et vous assurez de la qualité des services rendus dans ce domaine. Vous apportez votre expertise au développement de la géomatique.

Plus spécifiquement vous :

  • Participez à la coordination et au suivi des mandats de planification et d’analyses confiés aux consultants.
  • Dirigez les activités d’implantation d’ouvrages à construire et aux relevés des éléments en cours de la construction (X, Y et Z) en vue d’en déterminer les bons alignements avant l’acceptation des ouvrages en construction.
  • Analysez les documents reçus traitant de l’arpentage ou de la géomatique, détermine leurs acceptations, interprétez les résultats et fait des recommandations aux responsables des différentes divisions impliquées.
  • Préparez et/ou supervisez la préparation de plans, les descriptions techniques, les certifications de localisation et tous les autres documents qui relèvent de votre domaine d’expertise et signez et scellez les documents y afférents selon les prescriptions de votre ordre professionnel.

Le profil recherché :

  • Détenir un baccalauréat en sciences géomatique ou tout autre domaine connexe ;
  • Être membre en règle de l’ordre des arpenteurs-géomètres du Québec ;
  • Posséder huit (8) ans d’expérience pertinente à la fonction ;
  • Expérience des chantiers de construction ;
  • Expérience des réseaux de distribution d’eau potable et d’égouts, un atout ;
  • Attestation ASP- Construction ;
  • Permis de conduire (classe 5) valide.

Voici ce que nous vous offrons :

  • Un salaire de 85 671,03 $ à 112 690,80 $ par année ;
  • Un horaire de travail de 33,75 heures par semaine facilitant la conciliation travail-famille ;

La Ville de Laval est continuellement à la recherche de professionnels compétents et dynamiques qui désirent se joindre à une organisation entreprenante.  La Ville s’engage à vous offrir un milieu de travail stimulant !

Prenez part au changement dès maintenant et postulez en ligne, avant le 12 avril 2022en vous rendant sur notre site internet :

La Ville de Laval applique un programme d’accès à l’égalité en emploi. Elle valorise la diversité et invite les femmes, les minorités visibles, les minorités ethniques, les autochtones et les personnes handicapées à poser leur candidature. Pour ces dernières, ne pas hésiter à nous faire part d’arrangements spéciaux nécessaires, advenant que vous soyez invité à un processus de sélection.

De plus, vous coordonnez les mandats confiés à des firmes d’arpenteurs-géomètres, développez les devis techniques et vous assurez de la qualité des services rendus dans ce domaine. Vous apportez votre expertise au développement de la géomatique.']

title: Survey Crew Chief (Technologist)
description:
Location:  GTA Office â€“ Toronto â€“ Liberty Village

Who We Are

TULLOCH Engineering is a progressive, multi-disciplinary firm that believes in maintaining a family-oriented feel. We seek out opportunities to work on unique projects and thrive under the most challenging conditions where we bring a passion for finding solutions and a fierce enthusiasm in implementing them. Our employees are dedicated to quality and often go the extra mile to fulfill client requests. We are excited about our work in the fields of engineering, land surveying, environmental and mapping services. We employ over 350 professionals working from fifteen offices throughout Canada.

Our Geomatics team at TULLOCH offers services to clients in all major sectors across Canada. We often find ourselves working in locations that offer logistical challenges, but also impressive opportunities for success and learning. In addition to conventional surveying services, we also offer construction monitoring, precision layout, 3D laser scanning and bathymetry surveys. We are constantly thinking of innovative solutions and ideas and will utilize emerging technologies to improve both the efficiency and quality of deliverables to our clients.

About The Position

We are currently looking for a full-time Survey Crew Chief (Technologist) to join our growing Toronto team supporting transportation, transit, and rail infrastructure development in Southern Ontario. Our office is in the vibrant area of Liberty Village located just North of Exhibition GO, one stop from Union Station.

The ideal candidate will be:

  • Hard working with an innovative attitude and be adamant about honing their technical skillset in both field and office environments.
  • Committed to helping achieve our goal of expanding and winning work in the Greater Toronto Area.
  • Enthusiastic about the opportunity to work on flagship infrastructure projects in Toronto.
  • Adaptable and willing to travel out of town and do what it takes to get the job done! 

This is a permanent, full time position to begin as soon as a successful candidate is found.

Working under the supervision of a Project Manager,

the primary responsibilities will include:

  • Assessment of field and documentary evidence to perform cadastral surveys
  • Performing pre-engineering, topographic surveys while overseeing field activities
  • Performing high-precision surveys such as: layout, deformation monitoring, levelling, static control network surveys
  • Collecting field data using various survey instruments and GPS field equipment
  • Overseeing QC of data collection ensuring that field notes and daily downloads are complete
  • Collecting of terrestrial scanning data or aptitude and willingness to learn
  • Client interaction while on-site
  • Mentoring and training new field staff
  • Opportunities to work on proposals, reports and producing deliverables

Qualifications

  • Preferred candidate will have a minimum five (5) years practical related experience
  • Completion of a two (2) year minimum college program in geomatics technology or equivalent
  • Must be proficient in setting up, operating and troubleshooting Trimble survey equipment (or similar).
  • Must be comfortable with static control surveys, high-precision layout work and 1st order levelling techniques, or willing to learn
  • Knowledge of Ontario survey evidence assessment, Acts, Standards and Regulations as they relate to performing cadastral surveys
  • Willingness to pursue articling process towards becoming an OLS (optional)
  • Be well organized and have a career mindset
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Unwavering commitment to environmental health and safety in the workplace
  • Proficient in the operation of ATVs/UTVs/Snowmobiles
  • Willing to travel for site inspections and field work on occasion, sometimes on short notice and for long periods of time
  • Willing to mentor and train other colleagues
  • Valid Driverâ€™s License

If this seems like a great fit for you, please submit your application online at www.tulloch.ca. Thank you to all applicants for their interest. Only those candidates shortlisted for the position will be contacted. Please indicate your legal eligibility to work in Canada in your application.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the recruitment and selection process, or those needing job postings in an alternate format, please advise Human Resources when contacted for an interview.

title: Lead Land Surveyor
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

An exciting opportunity for a driven professional interested in taking the next step in their career: Wood Geomatics is seeking a full time Lead Land Surveyor for our Burlington office, that is both a current Ontario Land Surveyor and a current Canada Land Surveyor. With the support of Wood resources, you will be responsible for building and growing the surveying and geomatics business in southern Ontario as well as the supervision, direction and control of land surveying services related to various transportation, municipal and mining projects.

To succeed in this role, the successful Land Surveyor will be self-motivated and have a well-rounded background in the survey industry.

 

Working under the supervision of the Geomatics Discipline Lead, the primary responsibilities will include:

  • Managing survey projects in Ontario (project planning, schedule development and management),
  • Supervising and providing direction to field and drafting staff in the creation of both cadastral and engineering survey products, to ensure deadlines and objectives are met efficiently and on time,
  • Providing quality assurance and quality control of end results,
  • Taking professional responsibility for surveys performed,
  • Ensuring timely and accurate invoicing,
  • Maintaining professional communications with clients, staff, and the public,
  • Calculating/ checking parcel boundaries, construction layouts, control networks in a wide variety of markets,
  • Contributing to Business Development efforts with the aim of generating project work from new or existing clients.
  •  

Skills / Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree or Diploma in Geomatics Engineering or equivalent,
  • Minimum 5 years of experience as an Ontario Land Surveyor,
  • Active Membership with Ontario Land Surveyors' (AOLS) Association is required,
  • Active Membership with the Association of Canada Land Surveyors (ACLS) is required,
  • Other professional designations (i.e. PEng) will be considered an asset,
  • Strong computer skills with experience in related software (Trimble Business Centre, MicroSurvey, Civil3D, ArcGIS, Agisoft),
  • Proficient with UAV and 3D Laser Scanning Equipment and software for data processing, point clouds, and 3D modeling,
  • UAV / drone pilot license considered an asset,
  • Experience in precision spatial monitoring and deformation analysis considered an asset,
  • Excellent work ethic, resourcefulness, and time management skills,
  • Commitment to comply with Wood’s safety policies and procedures,
  • Valid, unrestricted Class 5 driver's license with clean abstract.
  •  

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Survey Party Chief
description:
Challenger Geomatics has an opening for an intermediate Survey Party Chief based in the Calgary area. The Survey Party Chief collects data in the field and works with our experienced project managers on a variety of survey assignments. This includes legal and construction surveys, working either on your own as head of the survey crew.

This position will be located out of Calgary office, but projects may be located elsewhere in Alberta. Candidates should have a willingness to travel to where the work is. You will have the chance to work on different types of projects and grow your career through participation in our training and development programs. Challenger Geomatics is an employee-owned geomatics firm and offers extended health and dental coverage, RRSP matching, and other employee benefits. 

General Responsibilities:

  • Completes field surveys and works closely with the Project Manager to ensure all client objectives are met.
  • Provides necessary documentation to office staff including any field notes, computations, and other survey data.
  • Communicates effectively with team members and ensures tasks are completed on time.
  • Performs all health and safety duties as identified in the company's safety procedures.
  • Skilled with the use of survey equipment (GPS/GNSS Rovers, Total Stations, Locators, etc.) and ensures all company equipment and vehicles are properly operated and maintained.

Qualifications

  • Diploma in Geomatics or related discipline as well as previous survey experience. 
  • Experience in the energy sector or construction is an asset
  • Valid Class 5 driver's license
  • Any valid safety certificates an asset (i.e. H2S, First Aid, CSTS, Wildlife Awareness)
  • Physical fitness - party chief must work outside in tough conditions, often carrying equipment long distances

title: Professional Land Surveyor (BCLS or other), Land Surveyor in Training (LST) or Survey Technician
description:
WHO WE ARE

ECORA IS AN ENGINEERING, ENVIRONMENT AND NATURAL RESOURCE CONSULTING COMPANY

We are committed to delivering quality services to our valued clients. Our incredible team of engineers, environmental scientists and resource professionals work together to provide clients with a synergistic offering of services unique to the industry. We are built on the foundation of our core values: commitment to our people, our relationships, our community and our environment. For more information about Ecora, please visit our website https://ecora.ca/.

THE OPPORTUNITY

We are looking for a Professional Land Surveyor (BCLS or other), Land Surveyor in Training (LST) or Survey Technician to join our expanding Legal Survey team, based in our Penticton office. This is a permanent, full-time position with competitive remuneration and benefits.

RESPONSIBILITIES

• Conducting legal and construction surveys;

• Calculating and drafting;

• Organizing field crews; and

• Participating as a member of an interdisciplinary team.

QUALIFICATIONS

• Professional Land Surveyor, LST or other;

• Minimum 5 years' experience in land surveying;

• Strong organizational and time management skills;

• Strong English language communication skills, both written and verbal; and

• A safety-oriented attitude with a strong work ethic and desire to excel and achieve.

NICE TO HAVES

• Familiarity with BC Legal Survey regulations and practices; and

• The ability to work independently under minimal supervision or as part of a team

REWARDS OF WORKING AT ECORA

• Working for one of the fastest growing firms in Canada and one of the most exciting engineering and natural resource consulting firms in Canada;

• Competitive salary;

• Paid annual vacation;

• Paid annual sick days;

• Comprehensive group benefits including extended health and dental coverage;

• Group RRSP match program;

• Ability to earn a bonus based on company success and employee contribution;

• Opportunities for professional growth and development; and

• Reimbursement of applicable professional membership dues.

Ecora is an equal opportunity employer and stays true to its mission by ensuring it leads with its values. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are core to our mission, Ecora strives to create a workplace that reflects the communities we serve and where everyone feels inspired and empowered to bring their authentic selves to work. We encourage, support, and celebrate the diverse voices of our team members.

How to Apply: https://ecora.breezy.hr/

Ecora thanks all applicants for their interest; however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Independent Field Surveyor
description:
Zip Code: H1S 1N2

Job ID: 3307

Standard Hours: 10-15

Compensation Range: $13 - $18

RetailData partners with the largest retailers in the world to provide competitive intelligence solutions. With consumers dynamically shifting their purchasing patterns between the various in-store and e-commerce sales channels, we are perpetually innovating new solutions and products to meet client needs. Our industry-leading expertise in price, assortment and promotional data sets, in conjunction with our expansive technology and analytics platforms, has positioned us perfectly to help retailers navigate these unprecedented retail changes.

Description:

Are you tired of being unsure how much your delivery/driver job will pay? Will the customer tip? We have a great side hustle job for you! Our jobs are preplanned with a flexible schedule, and the faster you get at the job the quicker you are in and out! Flexible when you go in and collect the work!

We provide detailed training to ensure you will achieve maximum efficiency in each store you will collect. You will control how much money you are able to collect per hour!

Great gig to earn extra money by working independently, good for anyone with flexible time to spare!

As a Store Scanning Specialist, you can enjoy the flexibility of choosing when and how much you earn. All you need is reliable transportation to start making money.



Why scan with RetailData?



Choose your own hours! When you work is totally up to you within our clients window

Easy to get started! We will provide detailed training

Earn extra money! Achieve your short-term goals or long-term collecting with RetailData

Make a guaranteed hourly minimum! (only for areas with wage floor)



Benefits:
  • Training to build speed and increase pay.
  • Ability to control what you earn.
  • Advanced notice of work schedule.
  • $400 referral bonus program.
  • As a part-time team member, you are offered identity theft protection, pet insurance, and 401k with match after 6 months and 750 hours worked.
  • Employee stock purchase after 1 year of service.
  • Independent, flexible work schedules that enable a healthy work-life balance.
  • Travel opportunities, locally and out of state.
  • Extra hours available in many areas.
  • Paid drive time and mileage reimbursement.

Come work for an essential business! We put an emphasis on A.R.T = A ccountability, R espect, T rust!

Requirements:
  • At least 18 years of age.
  • High school diploma, or equivalent.
  • Valid driver's license, clean driving record, reliable transportation, and valid automobile insurance.
  • Ability to work approximately 10 - 25 hours per week with scheduling flexibility.
  • Reliability to start and finish assignments on time with the detail needed to satisfy the project criteria.
  • Ability to stand throughout the work shift and lift up to 40 pounds intermittently.
  • Willingness to work in cold temperatures associated with grocery store refrigerator and freezer cases as some projects required collection of items in these store aisles.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: RetailData is committed to a policy of nondiscrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, or sexual orientation.

title: Senior Land Surveyor
description:
Are you a Registered Land Surveyor that is motivated to be an entrepreneur and community leader that would like to grow and become a partner of an Engineering and Surveying firm?  Do you live in Alberta and are ALS Certified and would like to make a move to Brockville, Ontario?  Brockville is located near Ottawa and Kingston and a few hours from Toronto.  

Our client is currently looking to fill a Senior Land Surveying position based in Brockville, Ontario.  The successful candidate would be responsible for all surveying operations as well as coordinating with the engineering and planning teams.

The company is a multi-disciplinary professional firm offering state of the art services by integrating Surveying, Planning, Engineering and Architectural Design. They specialize in small to mid sized residential, commercial, industrial, and institutional construction and development projects. A vibrant and modern company, they stand on  decades of experience and reliability.

Key Responsibilities
 ·  Manage all surveying operations.
 · Supervise and mentor surveying crews, office, staff, and supervisors.
 · All responsibilities under the AOLS Certificate of Authorization.
 · Certify all cadastral surveying operations.
 · Work with multi-disciplinary team such as planners, engineers, and architects.
 · Build and maintain client relationships and pursue business development opportunities.
· Interact with governing bodies, planners, landowners, real estate agents and other interested parties.

Minimum Requirements
 · Registered as an Ontario Land Surveyor (OLS) with AOLS.
· 5 years of experience as an OLS.
· Experienced in Cadastral Surveying and Geodetic Surveying.
· Experienced with Total Station, GNSS, and other current software.
· Entrepreneurial and business experience considered an asset.

  

 


Thank you for your interest in this job posting.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Surveyor
description:
Your Employer:

Dare to join Englobe

 

Englobe, and its more than 2,600 people concerned about the environment daily, engage in sustainable engineering, process soils and biomass, and manage the quality and integrity of assets.

 

At Englobe, we adopt innovative, human-centered management. We welcome new ideas and are open to discussion. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.

 

We offer

  • A full range of benefits (group insurance with shared costs upon hiring, group RRSP);
  • A telemedicine virtual healthcare service;
  • An annual reimbursement of sports expenses;
  • Opportunities for skills development;
  • Flexible hours and ability to compress working hours;
  • Internal policy to encourage telecommuting.

Dare Englobe and lead a career marked by growth and accomplishments.

Your Contribution:

 

As a Surveyor, you will work in collaboration with  the Instrumentation  & Monitoring  team.

 

Your main  responsibilities  will be:

  • Apply and promote  Englobeâ€™s  health and safety rules.
  • Assist the Surveying team in carrying out daily monitoring/surveying activities.
  • Understanding of geomatics and surveying basics utilizing a total station
  • Consistently executing prescribed technical procedures, safe work practices and work plans in a safe, efficient manner under all applicable regulatory requirements and contract specifications.
  • Coordinate and undertake planning and implementation of survey requirements to facilitate construction activities.
  • Maintain accurate survey records, documentation, and stamped submittal.
  • Generating deliverable documentation including technical reports and letters, summaries, data sheets, graphs, proposals, and qualification packages.
  • Work with field staff project needs to develop project specific plans and documents.
  • Produce work plans in which objectives are clearly defined and steps for achieving them are well detailed for project crews to follow.
  • Provide clients (internal and external) with efficient responses to inquiries.
  • Anticipate client needs and respond within a timely manner to each inquiry.  
  • Monitor project and team performance. Forecast project outcomes and adjust where necessary to deliver successful project outcomes.
  • Manage client expectations and scope changes through active communication.
  • Identify and resolve client, project and/or team issues.
  • Performs various tasks, including analyzing proposed project solutions to ensure structural reliability, resource efficiency and cost-effectiveness.
Your Profile:

 

  • Diploma or Degree in Geomatics Engineering Technology, B.Sc. in Geomatics, or related discipline.
  • 3+ years of previous surveying experience, specifically with utilizing a total station or similar equipment
  • Ability to work effectively and competently with people at all levels in the organization; is a great team member.
  • Ability to work without supervision, effective time management and strong organizational skills.
  • Contribute on an on-going culture of safety in all work environments.
  • Ability to work to deadlines and see tasks through to completion.
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Previous consulting experience is an asset.
  • Valid provincial driverâ€™s license required.
  • Demonstrated sensitivity and consideration for occupational health and safety.

title: Surveyor
description:
Overview:

ALERT: This role is CRAFT in the US and Non-Craft Hourly in Canada per the Davis Bacon Act.  

 

Conducts topographic and cross-section surveys to support planning and design of the project site using prescribed methods.

What you will be doing:
  • Provides work control lines and elevations that are required for accurate measurement and correct installation of materials.
  • Assists in the evaluation of potential dimensions and other field problems.
  • Performs layout work competently and accurately as specified by survey management.
  • Checks as-built conditions that require the use of surveying techniques.
  • Provides topographic and cross-section surveys as required for planning and payment quantities.
  • Assists with conducting quantity calculations as required.
  • Maintains knowledge of Companyâ€™s values and strategic plan.
  • Support published corporate policies.
  • Perform additional assignments per managementâ€™s direction.
What we are looking for:
  • High School Diploma / GED required.
  • 2+ yearsâ€™ experience in survey or land mapping required.
  • Bachelorâ€™s degree preferred.
  • Valid Driverâ€™s License
  • Knowledge of and proven practical use of survey instruments and practices.
  • Developing knowledge and technical use of survey programs and site layout techniques.
  • Team working skills.
  • Developing communication and technical understanding.
Why work for us:

Some of the benefits you may be eligible for as an employee are:

  • Comprehensive compensation package and paid time off program
  • Industry leading 401(k)/RRSP
  • Medical/Extended Health Care, Dental, Vison and/or Provincial Medical
  • Wellness benefits & Employee Assistance Program
  • Tuition Reimbursement Program

We are an EEO/AA/ADA/Veterans employer.

title: Project Technician/Construction Surveyor
description:
Location: Various Locations
Rotation: Various Rotations
Department: Operations

Key Areas of Responsibility:

In coordination with other crew members, the primary task of the Project Technician/Construction Surveyor will include the following during rehab, construction within an existing Transfer Station, and conveyor installation in the Conveyor Ramp:

  • Construction layouts for anchor bolt locations, grid lines, formwork, concrete piers, and footings in an underground environment
  • Surveying and checking for column plumbness with a total station during structural steel erection in an underground environment
  • Layout hanger locations
  • Layout and assist with alignment of overhead crane rails during installation
  • Mark up headings for rehab portion of scope
  • Perform routine check surveys to ensure precision and accuracy are maintained in mine survey data, control points, and survey stations are properly tied in
  • Establish new survey stations as required
  • Assist with creating red line mark ups during construction
  • Conduct routine survey reporting for underground construction and rehab
  • Prepare and implement processes and procedures
  • Assist QA/QC personnel when required
  • Assist in generating daily and weekly reports when required
  • Specify and order materials and supplies required for surveying
  • Other such duties as may be assigned

General Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Ensure full understanding and compliance with company policies and work in accordance with the Occupational Health and Safety Act and other local regulatory requirements
  • Have the authority and responsibility to maintain a safe and efficient working environment
  • Fully supports and actively participates in the team safety program based on culture and innovation
  • Ensure that any equipment deemed damaged or unsafe by virtue of a defect, or a machine of which any protection system is inoperative, is not used and communicated to the supervisor
  • Work closely with other crew members to create and maintain a synergy required to accomplish the shift line-up in the cycle
  • Ensure applicable procedures and work standards for all tasks are understood, adhered to and complied at all times for all such work
  • Maintain a high standard of housekeeping in the workplace
  • Utilize all safety systems as specified within the site safety management system

Pre-Employment Qualifications:

  • Pre-employment drug, alcohol and medical testing
  • Criminal Record Check
  • Mining Technician Diploma and experience with technical aspects of underground construction, mine surveying
  • Full Basic Underground Common Core
  • Minimum 3 years related underground mine surveying experience
  • Proficient with mine engineering programs such Mine Cad Software, AutoCAD, Total Station, and MOSS

Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities:

  • WHMIS
  • Fall Arrest
  • Lifesaver TM-60 (self-rescuer)
  • High level of personal integrity
  • Knowledgeable of innovative technologies, such as Mine CAD Software, AutoCAD, Total Station and MOSS
  • Demonstrate organizational skills with strong oral and written communication abilities
  • Underground construction survey experience
  • Attention to detail
  • Must be able to work with little supervision in a remote environment; must be self-directed
  • Excellent written and verbal communication, organizational and interpersonal skills
  • Able to effectively prioritize workload to ensure deadlines are met
  • Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, and Outlook

Supporting a Diverse and Inclusive Workforce

At Cementation Americas, we believe in diversity and inclusion. We recognize the benefits of a diverse and inclusive workforce and we strive to provide a work environment that is respectful to all employees. One of our core values as a company is giving employees every opportunity to succeed - this starts with treating everyone with dignity and respect and valuing the unique contribution of every employee.

We encourage applications from people of diverse backgrounds and candidates for employment will be assessed in a non-discriminatory manner. In addition to career development training, all employees are provided with diversity and inclusion training. As a team, we will continue to grow and learn together.

We offer a competitive compensation package for our employees, including a generous group benefits plan, and we are committed to providing training and development for all employees.


How to Apply:

Start your application today by following this link https://cementationjobs.applicantpool.com/jobs/. Alternatively resumes can be emailed to hrdepartment@cementation.com or faxed to 705-472-0078. When submitting your resume, please include relevant qualifications including, but not limited to, Ontario Common Core.

title: Chief Surveyor
description:
Chief Surveyor

Who we are

Englobe is distinguished by its wide range of services, its presence across Canada, its client satisfaction, and its customized approach with a wide range of services from consulting, turnkey project implementation and soil treatment facilities. Over the years, Englobe has acquired credibility and a reputation for people-centred values. DST Consulting Engineers Inc., a Division of Englobe, provides expert, innovative environmental and engineering consulting services - without surprises.

We offer 
 
  • Full benefits package (group insurance with cost-sharing upon hiring, group RRSP after 3 months, the possibility of time banking)
  • Annual reimbursement of physical activity costs
  • Skills development opportunities
  • Reimbursement of travel expenses

As a Chief Surveyor, you will work in collaboration with the Instrumentation & Monitoring team.
 
Your main responsibilities will be:

  • Apply and promote Englobe’s health and safety rules.
  • Leading the Surveying team in carrying out daily monitoring/surveying activities.
  • Consistently executing prescribed technical procedures, safe work practices and work plans in a safe, efficient manner under all applicable regulatory requirements and contract specifications.
  • Coordinate and undertake planning and implementation of survey requirements to facilitate construction activities.
  • Maintain accurate survey records, documentation, and stamped submittal.
  • Generating deliverable documentation, including technical reports and letters, summaries, data sheets, graphs, proposals, and qualification packages.
  • Work with field staff project needs to develop project-specific plans and documents.
  • Produce work plans in which objectives are clearly defined, and steps for achieving them are well detailed for project crews to follow.
  • Provide clients (internal and external) with efficient responses to inquiries.
  • Anticipate client needs and respond within a timely manner to each inquiry.  
  • Monitor project and team performance. Forecast project outcomes and adjust where necessary to deliver successful project outcomes.
  • Manage client expectations and scope changes through active communication.
  • Identify and resolve client, project and/or team issues. 
  • Performs various tasks, including analyzing proposed project solutions to ensure structural reliability, resource efficiency and cost-effectiveness.

Qualifications:

  • Diploma or Degree in Geomatics Engineering Technology, B.Sc. in Geomatics, or related discipline.
  • Must be an Ontario Land Surveyor (OLS) in good standing with the Association of Ontario Land Surveyors (AOLS).
  • 5+ years of previous project management experience, ideally within the engineering industry.
  • Active participation in the Ontario legal survey industry.
  • Ability to work effectively and competently with people at all levels in the organization; is a great team member.
  • Ability to work without supervision, effective time management and strong organizational skills.
  • Contribute to an ongoing culture of safety in all work environments.
  • Ability to work to deadlines and see tasks through to completion.
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Previous consulting experience is an asset.
  • Valid provincial driver’s license required.
  • Demonstrated sensitivity and consideration for occupational health and safety.

Englobe & DST adheres to employment equity and equal opportunity programs and encourages all women, visible minorities, Aboriginals, and disabled persons to apply.

Only selected candidates will be contacted.

How to apply
Please forward your resume and cover letter to humanresources@dstgroup.com, and please quote Job # 21-1207


About DST Consulting Engineers:

Providing expert, innovative environmental and engineering consulting services - without surprises - is what DST Consulting Engineers Inc. does best. We are a multi-disciplinary firm providing comprehensive services to clients across Canada. DST’s nation-wide team is comprised of exceptional people in various stages of their career. We come together each day to make the unexpected happen. Growing our team means we are in pursuit of brilliant individuals who can rise to the challenge.

title: Leak Survey Technician - Markham
description:
• Full-time permanent position. Monday-Friday
  • Entry-level
  • Competitive hourly rate ($18.58 starting wage) with regularly scheduled opportunities for performance-based raises and bonuses
  • Exceptional health benefits, including for family
  • Defined contribution pension plan and employee assistance program
  • Company cell phone provided
  • Company car provided for work only, which you can park at home
  • Work independently outdoors

Wouldn’t it be great to find a company that will give you a chance to prove yourself, and grow a career quickly?

Look no further. G-Tel is hiring and training new Leak Survey Technicians to complete jobs in and around your area. The G-Tel family includes multiple growing companies providing electrical distribution infrastructure, energy and power generation services.

 

In this role, you will:

  • Receive full 3 - 4 weeks’ training
  • Receive assignments and routes to follow each day
  • Use state of the art equipment (including infra-red and flame ionization) to examine buried gas lines, and detect/report buried gas leaks.
  • Prepare reports and documentation that based on your work
  • From there, your reports will go to the people who repair the leaks, so they can make sure the gas lines stay in good working order.

 

Qualifications

  • Have experience, or would definitely enjoy, working outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Be physically fit and able to walk frequently (up to 20-25km/day), sit in a vehicle, and lift/carry up to 20 lbs
  • Be able to visually distinguish colours
  • Have a valid Ontario “G” class driver’s license and be able to produce a clean drivers abstract
  • Have a high school diploma
  • Be willing to obtain and wear CSA approved steel toe safety boots
  • Be willing to undergo and successfully clear a criminal background check
  • Willingness to work weekends and overtime is an asset, but not required
  • Have general computer knowledge (browser, email, Microsoft Office)

Note: Proof of COVID vaccination is not required.

title: Field Survey Technician
description:
The Opportunity: 
McElhanney Ltd. has a rewarding opportunity for an individual to join our team as a Field Survey Technician to join our team in Peace River, AB. We are a unique office that provides a wide range of engineering services to clients throughout Northwestern Alberta.

This position requires a motivated, highly productive person to lead a busy survey crew carrying out legal, topographic, and construction layout surveys. The successful candidate will work within a team on a variety of projects including Land Development, municipal infrastructure, and road construction. In this role you will work alongside experienced survey technicians under supervision of an Alberta Land Surveyor. This role is ideal for a coachable individual who is excited to be a part of a growing team in a fast-paced industry.

What You’ll Be Doing
  • Lead a field crew (2 person or independent) for various surveys including legal, land development (subdivisions), topographic, and construction layout.
  • Provide on-site contractor inspections to monitor the quality and progress of the work being performed
  • Perform on-site liaison between Project Manager and client/contractor as required.
  • Perform computations of survey data as required.
  • Manage flow of information between field and office, and prepare clear, concise and accurate field notes, records and calculations.
  • Be forward thinking; understand the construction progress and be able to learn the specifications and requirements of the work which they will be inspecting
  • Help prepare monthly progress payments and other associated Contract Administration tasks
  • Provide mentorship and leadership to junior or support staff.
  • Understand, commit to, and fulfill responsibilities under the McElhanney Quality Management System, ISO 9001 and all client quality, safety, and environmental management systems

 What You’ll Bring 
  • 2-year technical diploma in Geomatics with at least 5 years’ previous experience in a similar role
  • Periods of travel will be required for the role
  • Willingness to commit to construction projects for the duration of the project
  • Experience with Municipal, Highways, or Bridge construction projects is an asset
  • Proficiency in computer systems, and survey related software applications (MicroSurvey/StarNet, AutoCAD Civil 3D, and Trimble Business Centre software knowledge an asset)
  • Ability to foresee potential issues and problems so these items can be addressed and resolved
  • Exceptional organization and follow-up skills; ability to thrive in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment, meticulous note keeping
  • Clean driving record and the ability to comply with client-driven D&A testing requirements
  • Effective communication skills

Key Characteristics for Best Fit:
  • Desire to work on construction projects in various locations throughout Northwestern Alberta
  • Enjoy working outdoors with willingness to work in adverse weather conditions and at night
  • Ability to work well with contractors and thrive in team environments
  • A curious individual who is eager to learn new skills, including the progression construction from drawings and specifications to a completed product.
  • The flexibility to learn new skills and expand your areas of expertise

What Can We Offer You?
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your busy lifestyle 
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave 
  • Great benefits, including extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching 
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone 
  • A family-like culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all 
  • Continuous support for your professional development and growth 
  • Ability to become a shareholder in an employee-owned company 

For a full review of our projects, please visit our online portfolio: https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 110 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As an employee owned and operated firm with over 1,000 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high level of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation, and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

#onsite  #LI-INTERMEDI #LI-AM3 #LI-onsite #INTERMEDIATE
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney’s Prairies region boasts successful operations in Calgary, Edmonton, Canmore, and Saskatoon. Our clients rely on us for consulting projects in Transportation and Municipal Planning and Design, Structural Design, Landscape Architecture, and Environmental services.
McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Survey Technician
description:
Survey Technician

Who we are

Englobe is distinguished by its wide range of services, its presence across Canada, its client satisfaction, and its customized approach with a wide range of services from consulting, turnkey project implementation and soil treatment facilities. Over the years, Englobe has acquired credibility and a reputation for people-centred values. DST Consulting Engineers Inc., a Division of Englobe, provides expert, innovative environmental and engineering consulting services - without surprises.

We offer 
 
  • Full benefits package (group insurance with cost-sharing upon hiring, group RRSP after 3 months, the possibility of time banking)
  • Annual reimbursement of physical activity costs
  • Skills development opportunities
  • Reimbursement of travel expenses
  • Flextime and the possibility of a compressed schedule

We are currently seeking a Survey Technician to work out of our office in Waterloo, ON.

Responsibilities:
  • Perform job site surveys and instrumentation monitoring of civil engineering structures, building, utilities, roadways, railway tracks, and bridges 
  • Install building, surface and in-ground survey monitoring points and other types of structural and geotechnical instrumentation at job sites.
  • Perform high-precision control surveys and baselines.
  • Complete calculations for structure and ground movement in the field and using data collector software.
  • Produce survey reports for Clients and construction project teams
  • Perform all aspects of construction and site surveying including layout, as-built, topographic, quantity, slope staking, grade staking, and various underground utility staking.
  • Work with another crewmate with a team mentality to produce a product and summary reports catered to the client's needs. Ensure crew members are working in a safe environment. 
  • Manage and maintain survey equipment and instruments, survey data, and records
  • Perform pre-and post-construction condition surveys and assist with noise & vibration monitoring operations.

Qualifications:
  • Diploma of Collegial Studies or Degree in Surveying and Geomatics / Construction / Civil / Geotechnical / Engineering Geology
  • Minimum 2 years of experience dealing with road/highway construction.
  • In-depth knowledge of highway/structure surveying procedures.
  • Solid geometry/mathematical background.
  • Good knowledge of data collector software - Trimble Access & Survey Pro.
  • Competent with Trimble & Leica total stations and GPS.
  • Valid driver's licence.
  • Valid First Aid Level C-CPR & AED.
  • Ontario Land Surveyors license is considered an asset.

Englobe & DST adheres to employment equity and equal opportunity programs and encourages all women, visible minorities, Aboriginals, and disabled persons to apply.

Only selected candidates will be contacted.

How to apply
Please forward your resume and cover letter to humanresources@dstgroup.com, and please quote Job # 21-1233



About DST Consulting Engineers:

Providing expert, innovative environmental and engineering consulting services - without surprises - is what DST Consulting Engineers Inc. does best. We are a multi-disciplinary firm providing comprehensive services to clients across Canada. DST’s nation-wide team is comprised of exceptional people in various stages of their career. We come together each day to make the unexpected happen. Growing our team means we are in pursuit of brilliant individuals who can rise to the challenge.
