title: Survey Crew Chief
description:
At GeoVerra, itâ€™s about more than surveying land. Joining our team means youâ€™ll step into a career with wide-open opportunities. Experience new places, challenges that grow you, and a dynamic pace of work in which two days are never the same. If youâ€™re most at home in the outdoorsâ€”where fresh air, towering trees and occasional wildlife become your second-favourite coworkersâ€”then our Survey Crew Chief position located in Moose Jaw or Regina, Saskatchewan might be the perfect fit.

Our company is in acceleration mode. GeoVerraâ€™s growth is based on real partnerships, and we credit it to the people and culture that make us who we are to set us apart. In fact, your career here will be unique to you, and thatâ€™s how we like it. We value your sharp skills, creative mind, and technical brain.

The most important thing to know? Weâ€™re a team of experienced and professional employees who genuinely believe in the work we do. We support each other in a safe and positive working environment. At GeoVerra, you never go at it alone. Dig deeper. Broaden your horizons. Weâ€™re here for it all. And with fantastic benefits, work-life balance, and professional development options, we make it easier to chase your dreams.

The Partnership Promise
This is our commitment to provide responsive, trustworthy, industry expertise and a solutions-oriented approach to our clients, but we extend this way of thinking in all we do. It shows up in the form of work ethic, teamwork, safety and support for our GeoVerra family.

You GeoVerra
Our new Survey Crew Chief must be passionate about spending time in the field. Whether you have a technical background or love exploring every nook and cranny outside, you should have
an unquenchable thirst for seeing and doing it all.

This position requires a quick and engaged learner, with proven success in adaptability, productivity and high physical capabilities. Ideally, you are organized and highly collaborative, with strong communication skills and an infectious positivity that encourages this attitude in all team members. You will have a strong handle on equipment and field tools, with a healthy respect for the outdoors and the timeline of
the task at hand.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and perform field survey work;
  • Liaise with Project Managers to coordinate field survey work, to review and manage project budgets, timeline requirements, priorities and survey methodology;
  • Act as a company representative, liaising directly with client field representatives and land owners;
  • Prepare and communicate field notes, sketches, checklists and digital data in required formats for Project Managers, Land Surveyors and Drafting personnel;
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to Survey Assistants working with you;
  • Contribute to the development and implementation of industry best practices, more efficient field processes and procedures and the innovative use of new technology; 
  • Actively participate in and proactively support the advancement of the GeoVerra safety program;
  • Some office technical survey work may be required in this position; and
  • Other duties as assigned/required

Qualifications

  • Our successful candidate will be a graduate of a recognized post-secondary program related to surveying and geomatics or have an equivalent amount of related experience.  
  • 1 years experience;
  • Strong working knowledge of survey equipment and software such as GPS and Total Stations (Including Robotic);
  • Knowledge and experience of Trimble equipment and software, laser scanning and line locating would be considered an asset;
  • Strong problem-solving skills in a field environment;
  • Effective communication skills - verbal and written; ability to produce accurate and legible field notes;
  • The ability to develop and motivate survey staff and work well in a team environment;
  • An aptitude for delivering projects on time and budget;
  • Experience with the use of ATVs/UTVs, snowmobiles and chainsaws would be considered an asset;
  • A valid Class 5 driverâ€™s license and can provide a clean driverâ€™s abstract;
  • Completed training and valid tickets in First Aid, H2S and CSTS safety training, is an asset.
  • All employment offers for Safety Sensitive positions are conditional upon the successful completion of a Negative Drug Screen and Passing Alcohol Screen. 

Timeline
Full time, beginning immediately
 

At this time GeoVerra does not mandate COVID-19 vaccine for employees. With that, many GeoVerra clients have incorporated proof of vaccine practices due to COVID-19 and this may require you to provide proof of immunization when accessing their sites.

GeoVerra has every intention of fostering diversity within and across our organization. We welcome those who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff including, but not limited to, women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.

title: Field Survey Technologist
description:
The Opportunity:
McElhanney has an opportunity for a Field Survey Technicianjoin our team! Reporting to the Project Manager or Field Supervisor, you will direct the field crew to complete projects in an accurate, timely, and efficient manner to meet contractual and legal obligations. You will also be involved in engineering, construction or legal surveying in rural and remote areas.

There is a significant opportunity to work in the emerging markets with projects across western Canada to keep you busy. This is a great opportunity for an individual that is looking to further their career in Geomatics Engineering with a well-established company.

What You’ll Be Doing:
  • Take direction from Project Manager to understand the following: project objectives, allocated budgets, goals, schedules, and timeframes
  • Communicate scope and schedule information to team members, set expectations, and ensure project tasks are completed on time
  • Field completion of various types of surveys including engineering, construction, and legal surveys
  • Liaise between Project Manager and client representative
  • Manage information flow from field to office and prepare clear, concise and accurate field notes, records and calculations
  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety, and policy compliance.

What You’ll Bring:
  • Two-year technical diploma or degree in geomatics or civil engineering with up to 5 years of previous experience in a similar role, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Physically fit, able to lift heavy equipment, willing to work in various environmental conditions with varied terrain, able to work in wildlife populated areas, and willing to work in remote areas for extended periods and varied hours
  • Experience with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey and Trimble Business Centre is an asset
  • Valid driver’s license required
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, good attendance, sound judgment skills, and general computer knowledge.
Note: The ability to travel and work out of town in remote areas for extended periods of time is required. Pre-employment drug and alcohol testing will be on-going and unscheduled as required.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your busy lifestyle
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching
  • Employee & Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support online or over the phone
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Competitive salary, participation in our generous performance bonus plan, and opportunity to join an employee-owned firm with potential share ownership
  • Continuous support for your growth through professional development reimbursement, mentorship programs, and opportunity to join numerous internal committees.
For a full review of our projects, please visit our online portfolio: https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.
Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.
  #LI-AM3 #intermediate #Hybrid
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

title: Survey Party Chief
description:
Position Overview:

We are seeking the right individuals to join our Northern Team at Sub-Arctic Geomatics for permanent and seasonal roles.  Our surveyors and experienced project managers have worked in nearly every community and region over decades of working in the Northwest Territories and Nunavut.

The Survey Party Chief reports to the Branch Manager and is accountable for effectively and efficiently carrying out field survey assignments. 

General Responsibilities:

  • Works independently or leads a crew that conducts field surveys as defined by the project manager.
  • Communicates effectively with the project manager as to their progress.
  • Provides comprehensive survey notes/sketches, computations, and data in support of all field surveys; ensures all documents conform to company standards.
  • Monitors each project from start to completion, as to the quality of service provided and results achieved.
  • Performs all health and safety duties as identified in the company's safety procedures.
  • Ensures all company equipment and vehicles are properly operated and maintained.

Qualifications

  • Must have completed a recognized geomatics post-secondary program OR can demonstrate they have an equivalent combination of geomatics training and experience;
  • Skilled with GPS, Total Stations, and other survey equipment;
  • Willing and able to work outside in the field in all weather conditions;
  • Willing and able to travel extensively and be away from home frequently;
  • Must be able to pass drug and alcohol testing as required to access work sites.
  • Valid Class 5 driver's license


Assets

  • Safety Training (i.e. H2S, First Aid, CSTS, Wildlife Awareness)
  • Line Locating Certifications
  • Microsurvey, Carlson, or AutoCAD experience


Physical Demands:

  • Walking – Frequent  
  • Lifting ±25lbs
  • Carrying ±25lbs – Frequent
  • Driving (sitting) – Frequent

title: Chief Surveyor
description:
Your Employer:

Dare  to join  Englobe  

 

Englobe,  and itâ€™s more than  2,600 people,  concerned about the environment daily, engaged  in sustainable engineering, process soils and biomass, and manage  the quality and integrity of assets.    

 

At Englobe, we adopt innovative, human-centred  management. We welcome new ideas and are open to discussion. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.    

 

We offer  

 

  • A full range of benefits (group insurance with shared costs upon hiring, group RRSP);
  • A telemedicine virtual healthcare service;
  • An annual reimbursement of sports expenses;
  • Opportunities for skills development;
  • Flexible hours and ability to compress working hours;
  • Internal policy to encourage teleworking.

 

Dare  to join  Englobe and lead a career marked by growth and accomplishments.    

Your Contribution:

As a Chief Surveyor, you will work in collaboration with  the Instrumentation  & Monitoring  team.

 

Your main  responsibilities  will be:

  • Apply and promote  Englobeâ€™s  health and safety rules.

  • Leading the Surveying team in carrying out daily monitoring/surveying activities.

  • Consistently executing prescribed technical procedures, safe work practices and work plans in a safe, efficient manner under all applicable regulatory requirements and contract specifications.
  • Coordinate and undertake planning and implementation of survey requirements to facilitate construction activities.
  • Maintain accurate survey records, documentation, and stamped submittal.
  • Generating deliverable documentation including technical reports and letters, summaries, data sheets, graphs, proposals, and qualification packages.
  • Work with field staff project needs to develop project specific plans and documents.
  • Produce work plans in which objectives are clearly defined and steps for achieving them are well detailed for project crews to follow.
  • Provide clients (internal and external) with efficient responses to inquiries.
  • Anticipate client needs and respond within a timely manner to each inquiry.  
  • Monitor project and team performance. Forecast project outcomes and adjust where necessary to deliver successful project outcomes.
  • Manage client expectations and scope changes through active communication.
  • Identify and resolve client, project and/or team issues.
  • Performs various tasks, including analyzing proposed project solutions to ensure structural reliability, resource efficiency and cost-effectiveness.
Your Profile:
  • Diploma or Degree in Geomatics Engineering Technology, B.Sc. in Geomatics, or related discipline.
  • Must be an Ontario Land Surveyor (OLS) in good standing with the Association of Ontario Land Surveyors (AOLS).
  • 5+ years of previous project management experience, ideally within the engineering industry.
  • Active participation in the Ontario legal survey industry.
  • Ability to work effectively and competently with people at all levels in the organization; is a great team member.
  • Ability to work without supervision, effective time management and strong organizational skills.
  • Contribute on an on-going culture of safety in all work environments.
  • Ability to work to deadlines and see tasks through to completion.
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Previous consulting experience is an asset.
  • Valid provincial driverâ€™s license required.
  • Demonstrated sensitivity and consideration for occupational health and safety.

title: Leak Survey Technician - Scarborough
description:
• Full-time permanent position. Monday-Friday
  • Entry-level
  • Competitive hourly rate ($18.58 starting wage) with regularly scheduled opportunities for performance-based raises and bonuses
  • Exceptional health benefits, including for family
  • Defined contribution pension plan and employee assistance program
  • Company cell phone provided
  • Company car provided for work only, which you can park at home
  • Work independently outdoors

Wouldn’t it be great to find a company that will give you a chance to prove yourself, and grow a career quickly?

Look no further. G-Tel is hiring and training new Leak Survey Technicians to complete jobs in and around your area. The G-Tel family includes multiple growing companies providing electrical distribution infrastructure, energy and power generation services.

 

In this role, you will:

  • Receive full 3 - 4 weeks’ training
  • Receive assignments and routes to follow each day
  • Use state of the art equipment (including infra-red and flame ionization) to examine buried gas lines, and detect/report buried gas leaks.
  • Prepare reports and documentation that based on your work
  • From there, your reports will go to the people who repair the leaks, so they can make sure the gas lines stay in good working order.

 

Qualifications

  • Have experience, or would definitely enjoy, working outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Be physically fit and able to walk frequently (up to 20-25km/day), sit in a vehicle, and lift/carry up to 20 lbs
  • Be able to visually distinguish colours
  • Have a valid Ontario “G” class driver’s license and be able to produce a clean drivers abstract
  • Have a high school diploma
  • Be willing to obtain and wear CSA approved steel toe safety boots
  • Be willing to undergo and successfully clear a criminal background check
  • Willingness to work weekends and overtime is an asset, but not required
  • Have general computer knowledge (browser, email, Microsoft Office)

Please note: G-Tel does not require proof of Covid-19 vaccination.

title: Field Survey Technician
description:
Role Overview
McElhanney Ltd. has a rewarding opportunity for an individual to join our team as a Field Survey Technician to join our team in Courtenay, B.C. This position requires a motivated, highly productive person to lead a busy survey crew carrying out legal, topographic, and construction layout surveys.

The successful candidate will work within a team on a variety of legal and topographic surveys for Land Development, municipal infrastructure, and construction projects. In this role you will work alongside experienced survey technicians under supervision of a BC Land Surveyor. Our team offers a welcoming culture which allows staff to learn, grow, and build meaningful relationships. Most importantly, we have nurtured a fun and family like environment, making McElhanney a workplace where our staff choose to grow long-term careers. In addition, we have established programs that support the growth of our future leaders. We have built and sustained a reputation of taking great care in developing our people and fostering a positive, friendly, and rewarding work environment.
 
For additional information on Vancouver Island, visit our customized Vancouver Island careers page

 Responsibilities 

  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety and policy compliance.
  • Interpret field data in order to create accurate survey drawings and legal plans, which will include downloading and editing field data, interpreting field notes and sketches, and processing conventional and GPS data.
  • Communicate scope and schedule information to team members, set expectations, and ensure project tasks are completed on time.
  • Manage flow of information between field and office, and prepare clear, concise and accurate field notes, records and calculations.
  • Perform on-site liaison between Project Manager and client/contractor as required.
  • Implementing and ensure quality assurance on all field returns.
  • Maintain, test, calibrate and adjust survey equipment as needed.
  • Work with Project Manager for performance of office tasks.
  • Coordinate the preparation of documents and applications required for regulatory approvals.

Requirements
  • 2-year technical diploma in Geomatics with 0 - 5 years’ previous experience in a similar role; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Physically fit, able to lift heavy equipment, willing to work in various environmental conditions with varied terrain, able to work in wildlife populated areas, and willing to work in remote areas for extended periods and varied hours.
  • Experience with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey and Trimble Business Centre is an asset.
  • Valid driver’s license;
  • Periods of travel may be required for the role.
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, good attendance, sound judgment skills, and general computer knowledge.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Great benefits, including extended health & dental coverage, healthcare spending account, & RRSP matching.
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave.
  • Competitive salary and participation in our generous Performance Bonus Plan.
  • Financial assistance with relocation if applicable.
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all.
  • Continuous support for your professional development and growth.
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone.


This role is designated as a safety sensitive position.


Vaccination Requirement

 In accordance with the recommendations and guidance provided by government health authorities, McElhanney strongly encourages all employees to get fully vaccinated to protect themselves and others against the health and safety risks and the transmission of COVID-19 to others.  This position requires that the successful candidate is fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and as such, proof of vaccination will be required prior to the first day of employment. McElhanney will consider all accommodations required due to a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation. 

About McElhanney

Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

#LI-JUNIOR #LI-AM3  #LI-HYBRID
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.

title: Survey Crew Chief
description:
At GeoVerra, itâ€™s about more than surveying land. Joining our team means youâ€™ll step into a career with wide-open opportunities. Experience new places, challenges that grow you, and a dynamic pace of work in which two days are never the same. If youâ€™re most at home in the outdoorsâ€”where fresh air, towering trees and occasional wildlife become your second-favourite coworkersâ€”then our Survey Crew Chief position located in Grande Prairie, AB might be the perfect fit.

Our company is in acceleration mode. GeoVerraâ€™s growth is based on real partnerships, and we credit it to the people and culture that make us who we are to set us apart. In fact, your career here will be unique to you, and thatâ€™s how we like it. We value your sharp skills, creative mind, and technical brain.

The most important thing to know? Weâ€™re a team of experienced and professional employees who genuinely believe in the work we do. We support each other in a safe and positive working environment. At GeoVerra, you never go at it alone. Dig deeper. Broaden your horizons. Weâ€™re here for it all. And with fantastic benefits, work-life balance, and professional development options, we make it easier to chase your dreams.

The Partnership Promise
This is our commitment to provide responsive, trustworthy, industry expertise and a solutions-oriented approach to our clients, but we extend this way of thinking in all we do. It shows up in the form of work ethic, teamwork, safety and support for our GeoVerra family.

You GeoVerra
Our new Survey Crew Chief must be passionate about spending time in the field. Whether you have a technical background or love exploring every nook and cranny outside, you should have an unquenchable thirst for seeing and doing it all.

This position requires a quick and engaged learner, with proven success in adaptability, productivity and high physical capabilities. Ideally, you are organized and highly collaborative, with strong communication skills and an infectious positivity that encourages this attitude in all team members. You will have a strong handle on equipment and field tools, with a healthy respect for the outdoors and the timeline of
the task at hand.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and perform field survey work;
  • Liaise with Project Managers to coordinate field survey work, to review and manage project budgets, timeline requirements, priorities and survey methodology;
  • Act as a company representative, liaising directly with client field representatives and land owners;
  • Prepare and communicate field notes, sketches, checklists and digital data in required formats for Project Managers, Land Surveyors and Drafting personnel;
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to Survey Assistants working with you;
  • Contribute to the development and implementation of industry best practices, more efficient field processes and procedures and the innovative use of new technology; 
  • Actively participate in and proactively support the advancement of the GeoVerra safety program;
  • Some office technical survey work may be required in this position; and
  • Other duties as assigned/required

Qualifications

  • Our successful candidate will be a graduate of a recognized post-secondary program related to surveying and geomatics or have an equivalent amount of related experience.  
  • 1 years experience;
  • Strong working knowledge of survey equipment and software such as GPS and Total Stations (Including Robotic);
  • Knowledge and experience of Trimble equipment and software, laser scanning and line locating would be considered an asset;
  • Strong problem-solving skills in a field environment;
  • Effective communication skills - verbal and written; ability to produce accurate and legible field notes;
  • The ability to develop and motivate survey staff and work well in a team environment;
  • An aptitude for delivering projects on time and budget;
  • Experience with the use of ATVs/UTVs, snowmobiles and chainsaws would be considered an asset;
  • A valid Class 5 driverâ€™s license and can provide a clean driverâ€™s abstract;
  • Completed training and valid tickets in First Aid, H2S and CSTS safety training, is an asset.
  • All employment offers for Safety Sensitive positions are conditional upon the successful completion of a Negative Drug Screen and Passing Alcohol Screen. 

 

At this time GeoVerra does not mandate COVID-19 vaccine for employees. With that, many GeoVerra clients have incorporated proof of vaccine practices due to COVID-19 and this may require you to provide proof of immunization when accessing their sites.

GeoVerra has every intention of fostering diversity within and across our organization. We welcome those who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff including, but not limited to, women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.

title: Party Chief
description:
The Opportunity:
McElhanney has an opportunity for a Party Chief to join our team in Kitimat, BC! Reporting to the Project Manager or Field Supervisor, you will direct the field crew to complete projects in an accurate, timely, and efficient manner to meet contractual and legal obligations. You may also be involved in engineering, construction or legal surveying in urban and/or rural areas.

Why go north? The town of Kitimat offers a small town, tight-knit community feel with affordable housing, local schools and no traffic. Hike, fish, ski, golf, canoe, camp, mountain bike, sled, trail run or hunt – this town offers it all! With the announced $40-billion LNG Canada project, the largest privately-funded project in Canadian history, we anticipate a busy time ahead of us here at McElhanney. 

Learn more the benefits associated with living and working in Kitimat here.

What You’ll Be Doing:
  • Take direction from Project Manager to understand the following: project objectives, allocated budgets, goals, schedules, and timeframes
  • Communicate scope and schedule information to team members, set expectations, and ensure project tasks are completed on time
  • Field completion of various types of surveys including engineering, construction, and legal surveys
  • Liaise between Project Manager and client representative
  • Manage information flow from field to office and prepare clear, concise and accurate field notes, records and calculations
  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety, and policy compliance.

What You’ll Bring:
  • Two-year technical diploma in geomatics or civil engineering with up to 5 years of previous experience in a similar role, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Physically fit, able to lift heavy equipment, willing to work in various environmental conditions with varied terrain, able to work in wildlife populated areas, and willing to work in remote areas for extended periods and varied hours
  • Experience with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey and Trimble Business Cenre is an asset
  • Valid driver’s license required
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, good attendance, sound judgment skills, and general computer knowledge.

Note: The ability to travel and work out of town in remote areas for extended periods of time is required. Pre-employment drug and alcohol testing will be on-going and unscheduled as required.

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.
Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

 #Intermediate  #LI-AM3
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Survey Party Chief
description:
Challenger Geomatics has an opening for a Survey Party Chief based in the Edmonton region. The Survey Party Chief collects data in the field and works with our experienced project managers on a variety of survey assignments. This includes legal and construction surveys, working either on your own as head of the survey crew.

This position will be located out of Sherwood Park, but projects may be located elsewhere in Alberta. Candidates should have a willingness to travel to where the work is. You will have the chance to work on different types of projects and grow your career through participation in our training and development programs. Challenger Geomatics is an employee-owned geomatics firm and offers extended health and dental coverage, RRSP matching, and other employee benefits. 

General Responsibilities:

  • Completes field surveys and works closely with the Project Manager to ensure all client objectives are met.
  • Provides necessary documentation to office staff including any field notes, computations, and other survey data.
  • Communicates effectively with team members and ensures tasks are completed on time.
  • Performs all health and safety duties as identified in the company's safety procedures.
  • Skilled with the use of survey equipment (GPS/GNSS Rovers, Total Stations, Locators, etc.) and ensures all company equipment and vehicles are properly operated and maintained.

Qualifications

  • Diploma in Geomatics or related discipline as well as previous survey experience. 
  • Experience in the energy sector or construction is an asset
  • Valid Class 5 driver's license
  • Any valid safety certificates an asset (i.e. H2S, First Aid, CSTS, Wildlife Awareness)
  • Physical fitness - party chief must work outside in tough conditions, often carrying equipment long distances

title: Survey CAD Technician
description:
Role Overview
McElhanney Ltd. has an opportunity for a Survey CAD Technician to join our team in Nanaimo, BC! This role is ideal for someone who is looking for a challenging opportunity in CAD Drafting, with skills to be utilized on a wide variety of British Columbia construction and survey projects. The ideal individual will have five or more years’ experience drafting legal survey plans in British Columbia. AutoCAD Civil 3D experience will be a definite plus.

Live & Work in Nanaimo:
As the second largest city on Vancouver Island which has earned the title “Canada’s Sunporch,” Nanaimo is a thriving mix of restaurants, music venues, shops, galleries, and unique cultural elements—such as the world-famous Bathtub Races! Nanaimo is host to a multitude of retail opportunities including the largest mall on Vancouver Island - Woodgrove Centre. Offering natural beauty at every turn, from mountain wilderness to spectacular beaches, with vast recreational opportunities for everyone, you too can call Nanaimo home!
For additional information on Vancouver Island, visit our customized Vancouver Island careers page.
 
 Responsibilities 
  • Review field notes from the field crews and ensure the records are complete and meet project standards
  • Extract and calculate dimensions and coordinates from drawings, CAD files, and other sources
  • Upload and download survey data from various sources
  • Research an array of data repositories to identify land ownership and encumbrances on land
  • Prepare various legal survey and topographic survey plans

Requirements
  • Certificate or diploma in Geomatics or CAD
  • Previous experience with design/drafting is an asset
  • Proficient with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey, and other applicable survey software
  • Excellent attention to detail, good judgement and clear communication skills
  • Ability to work both independently and within a busy team environment
  • Willingness to work additional hours to meet project deadlines.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your busy lifestyle 
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave 
  • Great benefits, including extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching 
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone 
  • A family-like culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all 
  • Continuous support for your professional development and growth 
  • Profit sharing through an annual performance bonus program
  • Ability to become a shareholder in an employee-owned company 

Vaccination Requirement
In accordance with the recommendations and guidance provided by government health authorities, McElhanney strongly encourages all employees to get fully vaccinated to protect themselves and others against the health and safety risks and the transmission of COVID-19 to others.  This position requires that the successful candidate is fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and as such, proof of vaccination will be required prior to the first day of employment. McElhanney will consider all accommodations required due to a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation. 
 

About McElhanney

Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

 #Junior #Hybrid  #LI-AM3
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.

title: Land Surveyor
description:
The Opportunity 
McElhanney is looking for a Commissioned Land Surveyor for our Kamloops, BC office. The successful individual will have the opportunity to manage land development and infrastructure projects, utility right of way surveys, topographic surveys, construction and engineering layout, surveys on provincial and First Nations lands, and provide advice to clients. The ability to lead survey teams, provide advice to clients and colleagues and maintain project budgets is essential. This is a fantastic opportunity for career progression for a strong and enthusiastic individual who enjoys a challenge and the satisfaction derived from being part of an established multidisciplinary team.

McElhanney’s culture of teamwork, mentorship and career growth make this position ideal for the successful candidate to both mentor junior staff, collaborate with other land surveyors in McElhanney and to be mentored by senior management and surveying specialists within our organization.

Curious about what this opportunity could mean for you? Apply today and join us for a relaxed conversation to help us learn more about your potential new role.

Live in Kamloops
Kamloops is an affordable city with spectacular scenery and amenities, as well as endless outdoor and recreational activities. The Kamloops office is a highly profitable branch that continues to bid for and win many projects including land development, utility right of ways, topographic surveys, construction layout and surveys in our local region. Our office has been servicing local and regional clients with a full range of municipal and land development services for four decades, and our roots in the community run deep.

 What You’ll Be Doing  
  • Working in a team setting to establish project scope, budget and schedule, and other project or client expectations
  • Leading survey crews on projects; communicating scope and scheduling information to crew members
  • Managing project budgets and financial reporting
  • Managing various survey project types including statutory surveys, land development (subdivisions) and infrastructure, topographic, engineering and construction layout
  • Liaising with both internal (McElhanney) and external Project Managers and clients
  • Managing data flow from field to final deliverables
  • Ensuring quality assurance procedures are carried out for proposals, field returns, drawings, legal plans, documents, and other deliverables
  • Providing advice to clients on projects and legal survey matters
  • Other duties as required.
 
What You’ll Bring  
  • Commissioned BC Land Surveyor or candidate for Jurisdictional Exam
  • Diploma or degree in Geomatics with strong data processing/computations skills
  • Proficiency in computer applications (Civil3D or MSCAD and GNSS processing software at minimum)
  • Excellent communication, teamwork, and leadership skills
  • Must have or obtain a valid driver’s license
  • Periods of travel may be required for the role.
  • Must be willing to mentor and train the next generation of land surveyors and survey staff

Note: This role is designated as a safety sensitive position and completion of a pre-employment drug & alcohol for work testing is required.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Flexible hybrid working model and hours to accommodate lifestyle needs
  • Dog-Friendly office to bring in your well-behaved best friend to work
  • New office space coming spring 2023 including free on-site parking, amazing patio overlooking the city of Kamloops
  • Great benefits, including extended health & dental coverage, healthcare spending account, & RRSP matching
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Competitive salary and participation in our generous Performance Bonus Plan
  • Financial assistance with relocation if applicable
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Continuous support for your professional development and growth
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone
  • Participation in our numerous programs that support our Four Cornerstones: people & communities, clients & partners, processes & technology, and financial.
  • Opportunity for the right candidate to become a shareholder in an employee-owned company
 
About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

#LI-AM3 #LI-JUNIOR #HYBRID #JUNIOR #LI-HYBRID
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careersto apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

title: Survey Party Chief - camp jobs and in-town opportunities
description:
Position Overview:

We are looking for Survey Party Chiefs to join our team in Fort McMurray with two different opportunities to choose from. Our first opportunity is a 14/7 rotation flying into site from Calgary or Edmonton. The second opportunity is residing in Fort McMurray and responsible for construction and legal survey projects out of our branch office as well as camp work.

Both positions will often require you to conduct field work on your own, therefore, we're looking for someone with several years of survey experience.


General Responsibilities:

  • Performs a variety of field survey assignments, working closely with the project manager and other technical staff.
  • Prepares comprehensive field notes, computations, and other documentation as required. 
  • Performs all health and safety duties as identified in the company's safety procedures.
  • Ensures all company equipment and vehicles are properly operated and maintained.


Qualifications

  • Diploma in Geomatics or related field
  • Able to setup and operate various survey equipment including GPS/GNSS, Total Stations, Locators, etc. 
  • 3+ years of previous survey experience
  • Physically fit and able to work outside in the field in tough conditions
  • Valid Class 5 driver's license
  • Any valid safety certificates are an asset (i.e. H2S, First Aid, CSTS, Wildlife Awareness)

title: Field Survey Technician
description:
Role Overview
McElhanney Ltd. has a rewarding opportunity for an individual to join our team as a Field Survey Technician to join our team in Surrey, B.C. This position requires a motivated, highly productive person to lead a busy survey crew carrying out legal, topographic, and construction layout surveys.

The successful candidate will work within a team on a variety of legal and topographic surveys for Land Development, municipal infrastructure, and construction projects. In this role you will work alongside experienced survey technicians under supervision of a BC Land Surveyor.

 Responsibilities 
  • Lead a field crew (2 person or independent) for various surveys including legal, land development (subdivisions), topographic, and construction layout.
  • Perform on-site liaison between Project Manager and client/contractor as required.
  • Perform computations of survey data as required.
  • Manage flow of information between field and office, and prepare clear, concise and accurate field notes, records and calculations.
  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety and policy compliance.

Requirements
  • 2-year technical diploma in Geomatics with at least 5 years’ previous experience in a similar role;
  • Effective communications skills;
  • Proficiency in computer systems, and survey related software applications (MicroSurvey/StarNet, AutoCAD Civil 3D, and Leica GeoOffice software knowledge an asset);
  • Valid driver’s license;
  • Periods of travel may be required for the role.

This role is designated as a safety sensitive position.

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.
Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.
  #LI-AM3    #Inermediate  #hybrid

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 
McElhanney’s Surrey Survey group is a multi-disciplinary professional office currently involved in many high profile projects. We enjoy a high level of job satisfaction due to solid team effort and a positive corporate culture.  Located on the 23rd floor of Central City Tower, our modern office space is near SkyTrain and readily accessible via public transit.
 
McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. title: Survey Crew Chief
description:
At GeoVerra, itâ€™s about more than surveying land. Joining our team means youâ€™ll step into a career with wide-open opportunities. Experience new places, challenges that grow you, and a dynamic pace of work in which two days are never the same. If youâ€™re most at home in the outdoorsâ€”where fresh air, towering trees and occasional wildlife become your second-favourite coworkersâ€”then our Survey Crew Chief position located in Llyodminster, AB/SK might be the perfect fit.

Our company is in acceleration mode. GeoVerraâ€™s growth is based on real partnerships, and we credit it to the people and culture that make us who we are to set us apart. In fact, your career here will be unique to you, and thatâ€™s how we like it. We value your sharp skills, creative mind, and technical brain.

The most important thing to know? Weâ€™re a team of experienced and professional employees who genuinely believe in the work we do. We support each other in a safe and positive working environment. At GeoVerra, you never go at it alone. Dig deeper. Broaden your horizons. Weâ€™re here for it all. And with fantastic benefits, work-life balance, and professional development options, we make it easier to chase your dreams.

The Partnership Promise
This is our commitment to provide responsive, trustworthy, industry expertise and a solutions-oriented approach to our clients, but we extend this way of thinking in all we do. It shows up in the form of work ethic, teamwork, safety and support for our GeoVerra family.

You GeoVerra
Our new Survey Crew Chief must be passionate about spending time in the field. Whether you have a technical background or love exploring every nook and cranny outside, you should have an unquenchable thirst for seeing and doing it all.

This position requires a quick and engaged learner, with proven success in adaptability, productivity and high physical capabilities. Ideally, you are organized and highly collaborative, with strong communication skills and an infectious positivity that encourages this attitude in all team members. You will have a strong handle on equipment and field tools, with a healthy respect for the outdoors and the timeline of
the task at hand.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and perform field survey work;
  • Liaise with Project Managers to coordinate field survey work, to review and manage project budgets, timeline requirements, priorities and survey methodology;
  • Act as a company representative, liaising directly with client field representatives and land owners;
  • Prepare and communicate field notes, sketches, checklists and digital data in required formats for Project Managers, Land Surveyors and Drafting personnel;
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to Survey Assistants working with you;
  • Contribute to the development and implementation of industry best practices, more efficient field processes and procedures and the innovative use of new technology; 
  • Actively participate in and proactively support the advancement of the GeoVerra safety program;
  • Some office technical survey work may be required in this position; and
  • Other duties as assigned/required

Qualifications

  • Our successful candidate will be a graduate of a recognized post-secondary program related to surveying and geomatics or have an equivalent amount of related experience.  
  • 1 years experience;
  • Strong working knowledge of survey equipment and software such as GPS and Total Stations (Including Robotic);
  • Knowledge and experience of Trimble equipment and software, laser scanning and line locating would be considered an asset;
  • Strong problem-solving skills in a field environment;
  • Effective communication skills - verbal and written; ability to produce accurate and legible field notes;
  • The ability to develop and motivate survey staff and work well in a team environment;
  • An aptitude for delivering projects on time and budget;
  • Experience with the use of ATVs/UTVs, snowmobiles and chainsaws would be considered an asset;
  • A valid Class 5 driverâ€™s license and can provide a clean driverâ€™s abstract;
  • Completed training and valid tickets in First Aid, H2S and CSTS safety training, is an asset.
  • All employment offers for Safety Sensitive positions are conditional upon the successful completion of a Negative Drug Screen and Passing Alcohol Screen. 

 

At this time GeoVerra does not mandate COVID-19 vaccine for employees. With that, many GeoVerra clients have incorporated proof of vaccine practices due to COVID-19 and this may require you to provide proof of immunization when accessing their sites.

GeoVerra has every intention of fostering diversity within and across our organization. We welcome those who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff including, but not limited to, women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.

title: Survey Party Chief
description:
Our Culture:
Our employees choose McElhanney because they value what our company does day in and day out. We are friendly, down-to-earth, collaborative, passionate, committed to safety, and contribute to the communities where we live, work, and play. Our company has a history of employees who have spent their entire careers at McElhanney – celebrating 30-, 35-, and 40-year anniversaries – thanks to rewarding projects and long-lasting relationships with amazing staff. At McElhanney, you get big company opportunities with a small company feel.

Vaccination Requirement: 
In accordance with the recommendations and guidance provided by government health authorities, McElhanney strongly encourages all employees to get fully vaccinated to protect themselves and others against the health and safety risks and the transmission of COVID-19 to others.  This position requires that the successful candidate is fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and as such, proof of vaccination will be required prior to the first day of employment. McElhanney will consider all accommodations required due to a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation.

The Opportunity:
McElhanney has an opportunity for a Survey Party Chief to join our Major Project team in and around Alberta! Reporting to the Pipeline Division Managers of Regulatory, Cadastral and Engineering Design Surveys, Construction As-built Surveys, or Operations and Maintenance Surveys and the Project Manager on your assigned projects, you will direct the field crews to complete projects in an accurate, timely, and efficient manner to meet contractual and legal obligations. The successful candidate will be working on major pipeline projects throughout the full lifecycle of our client’s pipeline projects, primarily focused on providing geomatic services to our clients in the Pipeline Operations and Maintenance Division.

This is a great opportunity for a dedicated individual who enjoys working in the great outdoors, looking to gain hands on surveying experience and gain valuable experience in the pipeline industry. This is also great opportunity for an individual that is looking to grow their career in Geomatics Engineering with a well-established company.

What You Can Expect
  • Secure project work for 2+ years
  • Competitive salary, including overtime
  • Flexible work rotations suited to your needs. As per work rotations and schedules provided by our clients and their prime contractors, rotations and shift schedules may change based on the industry and project type you will be working on.
  • Camp work, accommodations and living allowance provided based on travel requirements
  • Safety Training and certification
  • Safety allowance for personal protective equipment

What You’ll Be Doing
  • Participate and contribute to McElhanney’s Heath, Safety and Environment (HSE) program.
  • Attend and participate in McElhanney’s monthly field safety meetings.
  • Attend and complete all required onboarding orientations, safety training and meet or exceed all the required elements for certification.
  • Prepare, participate, and contribute to the daily HSE Safe and Quality Production (SQP) plan and facilitate morning toolbox safety meetings.
  • Take direction from Project Manager to understand the following: project objectives, allocated budgets, goals, schedules, and timeframes.
  • Communicate scope and schedule information to team members, set expectations, and ensure project tasks are completed on time.
  • Field completion of various types of surveys including pipeline, engineering, construction, and legal surveys.
  • Liaise between Project Manager and client representative.
  • Manage information flow from field to office and prepare clear, concise, and accurate field notes, records, and calculations.
  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety, and policy compliance.

What You’ll Bring
  • Two-year technical diploma in Geomatics or Civil Engineering with at least 5 years of previous experience in a similar role, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Capable of working independently and taking ownership of tasks with support from office staff.
  • Physical ability to work on busy sites with varied terrain and ability to lift heavy equipment.
  • Confidence performing high precision surveys for layouts and control surveys.
  • Experience with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey and Trimble Business Centre is an asset.
  • Experience with Underground Utility Locating and Ground Disturbance is an asset.
  • Valid driver’s license required.
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, good attendance, sound judgment skills, and general computer knowledge.

This role is designated as a safety sensitive position.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching.
  • Maternity and parental leave top-up.
  • Employee & Family Assistance Program, which offers support in person, online or over the phone.
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all.
  • Competitive salary, participation in our generous performance bonus plan, and opportunity to join an employee-owned firm with potential share ownership.

For a full review of our projects, please visit our online portfolio:https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation, and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

        #LI-AM3  #Junior  #LI-onsite
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

Sunny skies, a strong growing economy and no provincial sales tax make Calgary a destination of choice. With the pristine wilderness of Banff National Park less than one hour’s drive away, Calgary offers the best of two exciting worlds – from stimulating city life in Canada’s newest urban playground to the spectacular scenery and nearby outdoor adventure in the Canadian Rockies, the rolling foothills, and expansive prairies. Residents enjoy superb winter sports attractions like skiing and snowboarding which are matched in the summer by golf, hiking, mountain biking, camping, and fishing.
McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.

title: Land Surveyor, Project Manager
description:
Position Overview

The Project Manager is a land surveyor responsible for managing all phases of their projects. Preference will be given to candidates with a Canada Lands Surveyor (CLS) commission or those who have previous experience working in northern communities.

The successful candidate is expected to complete duties from inception to completion of the project and is expected to potentially cover all office and field aspects of the project. They must be able to work independently and be willing to travel within Nunavut and the Northwest Territories as needed. Support will be available from Yellowknife and other Challenger offices, but will often work with one other local team member.

The Project Manager will need to be able to perform a wide spectrum of survey work including legal surveys, real property reports, subdivisions, lot boundary retracements, construction layout, topographic surveys, control surveys, and mineral claim surveys.

This position will be located out of Iqaluit, NU, and will report to the General Manager, Sub-Arctic Geomatics. The successful candidate will be required to stay in Iqaluit from June to the end of October, with the possibility of working in our Yellowknife office during the off-season. They will set up and manage our seasonal office during this time and also prepare to close down the office at the end of the season.

Other Responsibilities:

  • Meets with clients to discuss project requirements and drafts proposals based on the agreed scope of work
  • Develops each project plan and assigns tasks to appropriate field and office staff
  • Continuously monitors project progress against budgetary and profit targets, and initiate appropriate changes as required
  • Ensures each project is carried out according to the standards set out by the company's health and safety program; regulatory requirements; professional requirements; and Challenger policy and procedures
  • Keeps abreast of technical, professional, or regulatory developments affecting the field and office procedures and is knowledgeable to expert in their use
  • Provides the information required for the development of proposals, project reports, client invoices and assist in collections on an as-required basis
  • Meets with local communities and different individuals on behalf of Challenger / Sub-Arctic and promotes our company and services

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Familiarity with logistics of working and traveling in the Northwest Territories and Nunavut
  • Solid working knowledge of MicroSurvey or Carlson, AutoCAD and the operation of Leica GPS and Total Station instruments.
  • Experience in the survey of mineral claims in the Northwest Territories and Nunavut an asset.

Qualifications:

  • 3 to 5 years of field and project management experience.
  • Degree from a Geomatics Engineering Technology program is considered an asset.


Corporate Overview:

Sub-Arctic Geomatics (Sub-Arctic), a Challenger Geomatics Ltd. company, is a professional northern survey firm with headquarters in Yellowknife and a seasonal field office in Iqaluit. Since 1992, Sub-Arctic has provided quality survey and geomatics services for a wide range of projects in Yellowknife, Iqaluit and across the Canadian North. Sub-Arctic has an excellent history of managing the relationships, logistics, and delivery of survey and geomatics services for projects in nearly every northern community and region. Since its inception, Sub-Arctic also holds the distinction of having been involved in the exploration and construction of every diamond mine in the north, and of having prepared approximately one-third of all Plans of Survey registered in the Northwest Territories and Nunavut.

We offer challenging and rewarding employment along with on the job training and educational courses that allow our team members to rise to their full potential. We pride ourselves in offering opportunities for growth across all our offices. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages to our employees. We are always looking for "talent"- people who will be challenged and engaged in a growing company. We know that it is through our talent that we can continue to attain our goals and realize our vision

title: Survey Crew Chief
description:
At GeoVerra, itâ€™s about more than surveying land. Joining our team means youâ€™ll step into a career with wide-open opportunities. Experience new places, challenges that grow you, and a dynamic pace of work in which two days are never the same. If youâ€™re most at home in the outdoorsâ€”where fresh air, towering trees and occasional wildlife become your second-favourite coworkersâ€”then our Crew Chief position might be the perfect fit.

The Partnership Promise

This is our commitment to provide responsive, trustworthy, industry expertise and a solutions-oriented approach to our clients, but we extend this way of thinking in all we do. It shows up in the form of work ethic, teamwork, safety and support for our GeoVerra family.

You GeoVerra

Our new Crew Chief in Calgary must be passionate about spending time in the field. Whether you have a technical background or love exploring every nook and cranny outside, you should have an unquenchable thirst for seeing and doing it all.

What GV Provides

  • Full time, flexible benefits program, RRSP match, wellness days, and paid vacation time
  • Paid training for all safety tickets required

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and perform field survey work with the help of Survey Assistants;
  • Liaise with Project Managers to coordinate field survey work, to review and manage project budgets, timeline requirements, priorities and survey methodology;
  • Act as a company representative, liaising directly with client field representatives and land owners;
  • Prepare and communicate field notes, sketches, checklists and digital data in required formats for Project Managers, Land Surveyors and Drafting personnel;
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to Survey Assistants working with you;
  • Contribute to the development and implementation of industry best practices, more efficient field processes and procedures and the innovative use of new technology; 
  • Actively participate in and proactively support the advancement of the GeoVerra safety program;
  • Some office technical survey work may be required in this position; and
  • Other duties as assigned/required.

Required Skills, Experience, & Behaviours

  • Our successful candidate will be a graduate of a recognized post-secondary program related to surveying and geomatics or have an equivalent amount of related experience;
  • Strong working knowledge of survey equipment and software such as GPS and Total Stations (Including Robotic);
  • Knowledge and experience of Trimble equipment and software, laser scanning and line locating would be considered an asset;
  • Strong problem solving skills in a field environment;
  • Effective communication skills - verbal and written; ability to produce accurate and legible field notes;
  • The ability to develop and motivate survey staff and work well in a team environment;
  • An aptitude for delivering projects on time and budget;
  • A valid driverâ€™s license and can provide a clean driverâ€™s abstract; and
  • Pre Employment Drug and Alcohol Testing;
  • All employment offers for Safety Sensitive positions are conditional upon the successful completion of a Negative Drug Screen and Passing Alcohol Screen. 

Working Conditions

Out of town work and frequent travel required;
Ability to carry, lift and push 50lbs on a regular basis;
Ability to work outside in all weather conditions;

 

At this time GeoVerra does not mandate COVID-19 vaccine for employees. With that, many GeoVerra clients have incorporated proof of vaccine practices due to COVID-19 and this may require you to provide proof of immunization when accessing their sites.

GeoVerra has every intention of fostering diversity within and across our organization. We welcome those who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff including, but not limited to, women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.

title: Survey Technologist
description:
The Opportunity:
McElhanney has an opportunity for a Survey Technologist to join our team in Prince George, BC! Reporting to the Project Manager, you will direct the field crew to complete projects in an accurate, timely, and efficient manner to meet contractual and legal obligations. You may be involved in engineering, construction, or legal surveying in urban and/or rural areas.

Why go north? The town of Prince George offers a small town, tight-knit community feel with affordable housing, local schools and no traffic. Hike, fish, ski, golf, canoe, camp, mountain bike, sled, trail run or hunt – this town offers it all!

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Take direction from Project Manager to understand the following: project objectives, allocated budgets, goals, schedules, and timeframes
  • Communicate scope and schedule information to team members, set expectations, and ensure project tasks are completed on time
  • Field completion of various types of surveys including engineering, construction, and legal surveys
  • Liaise between Project Manager and onsite client representative
  • Manage information flow from field to office and prepare clear, concise and accurate field notes, records and calculations
  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety, and policy compliance.

What You’ll Bring:
  • Two-year technical diploma in geomatics, civil engineering or Mineral exploration and mining technology with 0-2 years of previous experience in a similar role, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Physically fit, able to lift heavy equipment, willing to work in various environmental conditions with varied terrain, able to work in wildlife populated areas, and willing to work in remote areas for extended periods and varied hours
  • Experience with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey and Trimble Business Centre is an asset
  • Valid driver’s license required
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, good attendance, sound judgment skills, and general computer knowledge.
Note: This role is designated as a safety sensitive position. The ability to travel and work out of town in remote areas for extended periods of time is required. Pre-employment drug and alcohol testing will be on-going and unscheduled as required.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching
  • Employee & Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support online or over the phone
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Competitive salary, participation in our generous performance bonus plan
  • Continuous support for your growth through professional development reimbursement, mentorship programs, and opportunity to join numerous internal committees.

For a full review of our projects, please visit our online portfolio: https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio


Vaccination Requirement

In accordance with the recommendations and guidance provided by government health authorities, McElhanney strongly encourages all employees to get fully vaccinated to protect themselves and others against the health and safety risks and the transmission of COVID-19 to others.  This position requires that the successful candidate is fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and as such, proof of vaccination will be required prior to the first day of employment. McElhanney will consider all accommodations required due to a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation.
 

About McElhanney

Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation, and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

  #LI-AM3  #LI-Junior #LI-Hybrid
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.
